I enjoyed reading it rather than just rushing through to 'find out what happens'. I'm so glad I savoured it & I couldn't predict the finale. Thoroughly enjoyable & I'm sure it will be a modern classic. I have already bought a copy as a friend's birthday gift.

title: A chance to fall in love with beautiful writing
text_review: Beautifully written. The prose is mesmerising and evocative. The landscape is as much the heroine of the story as Kya, in fact the two are irrevocably intertwined. I loved every word of this book, even if I found the story a little predictable, with the ending somewhat contrived. To be honest by that point I was so in love with the book it hardly mattered. I can not wait to see what this author does next.

title: Highly recommended
text_review: What can I say a heartfelt read where each character gripped you with so many different emotions. You are truly drawn into Kaya's  life feeling her pain, loneliness and her love and respect for the nature surrounding her. You are taken through her journey as if it were you. I could not put this book down. Shedding a lot of tears along the way. The descriptive way this book was written you could picture every scene, I loved it.

title: A stunning piece of fiction
text_review: This achingly beautiful portrayal of abandonment, loneliness and romantic disappointment, is so much more than a coming-of-age novel. It‚Äôs a portrayal of humankind‚Äôs inherent connectedness to nature, and of the resilience that happens when that connectedness is all that is left in a young girl‚Äôs life. But it‚Äôs also a realistic portrayal of human failing ‚Äì of family breakdown, and of the societal rejection and cruelty that occurs against those people considered outsiders - especially when those outsiders are women. The poetic descriptions of nature interweave seamlessly with the plot to draw the reader in to the Marsh Girl‚Äôs world. I picked this book up idly, not expecting anything much, only to be knocked sideways by the way it drew me in. This is the most poignant and refreshingly unforgettable book I‚Äôve read for many years.

title: THE MOST BEAUTIFUL BOOK I HAVE EVER READ!!!!!!!
text_review: I'm 45 and in my lifetime as a bookworm, I've read a fair few books. Where The Crawdads Sing - is by far - the most beautiful book I have ever read. How Delia has depicted nature and the lead character's affinity and bond to and with it is astounding. So beautifully written that I had to put the book down sometimes to take a breath and take in the poetic prose she had written. Or the message she had conveyed. If you are a lover of nature and feel a bond with it then this is a book that will speak to you. P.s. Don't Google ANYTHING about this book whilst reading it! It will totally spoil it!!

title: Entertaining, but flawed, murder mystery
text_review: It was atmospheric in its depiction of the landscape and wildlife of the marshes and overall I found it an enjoyable read.  But I found it too unrealistic.  Kya would have been found and attacked, or worse, I think as a lone child, I just was not convinced of that.  The romance with Tate was fine but why make him some kind of saint? And why particularly a childhood sweetheart?  Too sweetly romantic for me.  Bit too binary in terms of goodies and baddies as well.  However, the inclusion of poetry in the plot is interesting and the descriptions are vivid.

title: Would definitely recommend
text_review: This is my favourite book of 2019 so far. A captivating story, beautifully written, which I think will stay with me for a while. A couple of times it brought me to tears, unexpectedly and suddenly, no gradual build up, just a sucker punch right in the emotions. Loved it.

title: Heartbreaking, makes you yearn for the freedom of the wilderness.
text_review: I loved this book, 1 strong female character that has everything good in her life taken from her. Her strength of character is amazing, you find yourself seeking the peacefulness of her location. The sense of isolation is overbearing at times, yet she still finds wonder and comfort in nature. So decriptive you can almost feel the heat of the scorching sun on her skin, smell the swamp all through the seasons, hear the buzz of the flies and squawks of the birds.

title: Not quite the real deal...
text_review: Starts well but then meanders through a rather cliched, overblown and ultimately disappointing second half of the book. The early scenes with Kya as a "child in the wild" are graphically described and quite emotionally engaging but the book becomes a romantic thriller which fails to deliver either a compelling romance or sufficiently potent thrills. The courtroom scenes are poorly realised, the prejudice & hatred that should pervade as the backdrop to the story, lack force - Harper Lee or even John Grisham it is not. The writing quality gradually degrades along with the plot and by th end it feels very rushed. The twist, when it comes, is not that twisty and I didn't really care.

title: Cautious 4 stars
text_review: Well written and engaging. I found myself turning pages earnestly, and I loved the ecological beauty present in the story. I loved the themes of loneliness and isolation and the quiet exploration of trauma, the damage it does to us through generations.Structurally, though, I wish the story had been better staggered against the murder mystery, and as a wholly subjective preference I found the ending very predictable. I say subjective because it was emotionally satisfying and that will be plenty for many folks, but it wasn't much of a reveal. Side note, the POV did funny things (a strange kind of not quite omni) and that was a little jarring for me at first.

title: Persevere and you will be rewarded
text_review: I would have given this book at least four stars if it wasn‚Äôt for the totally unbelievable first section that track Kya from such a young age, making the story line unbelievable.  However, from her teens it had sorted itself out and offered some beautifully descriptive writing ... you almost felt you were living in the marsh with her.  Really glad I read it ... very memorable.

title: Wonderful!
text_review: What can I say about a book which kept me riveted from the very first page. Maybe my love of both biology and psychology , both sciences very evident in this book, are what made me give a very rare five stars. Sadly I think this is her only fiction book so I will not be able to find such superb fiction immediately but look out for this very special author in the future.

title: Oh my...
text_review: Heart wrenching and beautiful.You feel like you are in the marshes with the heart-breakingly abandoned child, and share her wonder and love of all of nature that reveals itself to her.Can't see how the beauty of the prose will translate to film, but I can so easily see a version of this drifting elegantly, heart-achingly across our screens any time now.

title: A beautiful tearjerker
text_review: A  haunting tale set in the  marshes of  North  Carolina, it features memorable characters, some likable, some you'll loathe. The heroine survives abuse and rises to triumph but the path is far from easy. Nor is the triumph what you think it's going to be. The prose is simple and though at times it's poetic, it never obscures the narrative. This book is one of a kind.

title: Best Book I have read in a long while.  Maggie Smith
text_review: A great story of abandonment and survival in one of the most inhospitable and prejudiced places in North Carolina.  I loved the writers descriptive writing which allowed me to see everything so vivid.  The characters were so real and I laughed and cried with the main protagonist Kya during her coming of age through to a murder trial.  A great twist is something that leaves you saying 'That was a great book'.  Maggie Smith.

title: Fantastic storytelling
text_review: A breath of fresh air. A good story well told.* EditFor all the reviews saying this book is unrealistic as there's no way a six year old would be left to raise themselves. I would like to  remind people that there are still 6 year olds bringing themselves up today in third world countries. Back in the 1950's marshlands,where discrimination was rife, Kya in the story was one of these children.

title: Enthralling and beautifully written
text_review: I read this book in a day, the writing is beautiful, excellent characterisation of Kya, who inhabits the marshland. Delia Owens transported me with her evocative descriptions. We follow Kya‚Äôs journey from abandonment as a young girl, her battle against the odds through to womanhood, against the backdrop of a murder investigation and the most beautiful landscape whilst drawing us into the ecology of Kya‚Äôs world. Throw in the love interests and this has all the ingredients of a future classic. Can not recommend highly enough.

title: Immersion in a marsh countryside
text_review: This story was one of the  most delightful  reads I have experienced. The language was beautiful, the characters believable and sympathetic, and like many other reviewers I didn‚Äôt want it to finish. I read it too quickly for our book club, and it will one of the rare books I shall read again. I have visited North Carolina and the memories are very real in this book.

title: What a read.
text_review: It took me a while to get into this book but once in Oh My Goodness.The writing is so beautiful and the protagonist Kya is wonderful. It was an emotional rollercoaster, just what you want in a good book.It is the kind of book that stays with you and I felt a little bereft once finished.I would recommend this to anyone wanting to be totally immersed into a storyline.

title: An American novel written by an expert naturalist
text_review: I loved this book. The start is heart-breaking, when the young girl at the centre of the story is abandoned, but she lives on, in the most challenging circumstances. The way she is neglected by, almost invisible to, the sparse local population is horrifying and yet convincing. It is Nature that brings her solace and her own quick wittedness that takes her forward, day by day.Delia Owens knows the area well and her detailed descriptions bring North Carolina's marshes and swamps alive. Although I've never visited south-eastern USA, I almost feel I could paint you a picture of what I would have seen there in the 1960s.We get to know the various characters more through their actions and speech than by description. The longing for love and security felt by Kya is almost unbearable and is snatched away from her several times. At the end of the story, you need a good break before tackling another book.Reading Owens' prose, I kept wanting to jot down phrases and sentences but because I also wanted to know what was going to happen next, I never did! Everyone in my reading group gave it five stars.

title: Breathtaking, rich and consuming.
text_review: This is the richest and most emotional book that I‚Äôve ever read. I think I cried 10 plus times towards the end. I really can‚Äôt believe that this book has received anything below a 5 star review.This is author will clearly become a HUGE name is she carries on writing.Her style is beautiful and I loved the details in each persons accents. It immersed me into the book.The characters are extremely well developed and are all so unique.I was definitely connected to them and think my favourites we‚Äôre Kya, Tate and Jumpin‚ÄôSo happy a read this book. Stop thinking about it and just buy it!

title: Loved it, what a story.
text_review: I know some have only given it 1 star but I can‚Äôt understand why, it‚Äôs a beautiful book. I couldn‚Äôt put it down. Maybe it‚Äôs because they can‚Äôt identify with loneliness and this book has it in droves, kya forced to grow up alone, become a woman on her own, defend herself, look out for number 1 and the little twist at the end. Well I loved it and it‚Äôs one of those books I‚Äôll be reading again and again.

title: Excellent read!
text_review: Read several very negative reviews before I decided to make my own judgement.I was glad that I did as I found it to be one of the best books that I have read for ages. Story superbly constructed, wildlife descriptions splendid and psychological examinations clearly explained. I wonder if the negativos read the correct book. Well written Delia - thank you!

title: Hard to fulfil the Hype.
text_review: I quite enjoyed this book but given the hype surrounding it, I expected more from it. It is a very easy read but quite far-fetched and I found it ultimately disappointing.

title: Poetic, graceful, ethereal
text_review: One of the best books I‚Äôve read. I just love the poetic willowy feel of the book, the attention to the beauty of nature and the beauty of a girl unspoilt by the world. I love the twists and turns, the attention to prejudice in all its forms - subtle and overt. The unlikely friendships made and the path of love. I just adored it. Bought two for friends for Christmas.

title: Wow
text_review: I heard amazing things about this book, and as is my nature, I was sceptical!I initially downloaded the sample and once I reached the end, I had to buy the book straight away. Within 48 hours I completed the book (which is an achievement being a busy mum of a large brood).I could not put this book down, I experienced a variety of emotions, I giggled in places and cried at others. This story is one of the best I have ever read....don‚Äôt wait any longer.....read the book!

title: Beautiful, a welcomed escape
text_review: I used to think of myself as a bookworm but life seems to have taken over in recent years. Being stuck inside has made me read more and this has been the best book I‚Äôve picked up.People are saying parts of this novel are unrealistic and suspending their disbelief was too hard. Yet isn‚Äôt it the stories so undoubtedly contrasting with our own experience of life that make us turn the page? Realism is a hard fact, harder right now then before. The soft escape with the Marsh Girl left me enchanted and I fell in love with her from the first page.

title: Crawdads don‚Äôt sing. They cry.
text_review: Great storytelling about a child abandoned by her much-loved mother and all her family to fend for herself in the marshes of North Carolina. In the final analysis, despite its slow start and its overuse of poetry, it is a good read. The main protagonists are not my favourite characters.Jumpin‚Äô, Mabel and the courtroom cat, Sunday Justice, are. Crawdads don‚Äôt sing. They can if you want them to.

title: Highly Recommended
text_review: Where the Crawdads Sing is a remarkable book. All of the characters are really well written, especially the main character Kya (AKA Marsh Girl). I loved the format of the book and the way 2 narratives are told until eventually they come together. If you‚Äôre a fan of murder mysteries this book is for you! Equally I found this book to be very peaceful and beautiful at times, especially when it came to Kya and her interest in the wildlife surrounding her!

title: A superior potboiler
text_review: This was a readable story but not the great book most of America seemed to think!  The plot is hugely implausible, the characters are often stereotypes and the writing is very variable ranging from the over-written to the downright sloppy.  Having said that, my reading group enjoyed the 'nature writing' aspect and found it light relief in hard times.

title: Memorably beautiful writing!
text_review: This is a wonderful first novel which will live long in my memory. I fell in love with the character, Kia and rooted for her through her every disappointment and every success... The author brings such skill of insight and such truthful observation to not only her intimate knowledge of the landscape and its wildlife but crucially also to the inner landscape of the little abandoned child's thoughts and sensitive feelings. This is special... never a false note is struck... If you are a reader, don't miss this one!

title: RARE BEAUTY
text_review: I don‚Äôt write many reviews but I had to write one for this book. After reading many, many books throughout my life, this book is one that will stay with me. What a rare beauty this book is, every page fills you with the sounds, the smells, the setting, the characters. I was there with her, looking at nature as Kya was looking at it. I actually had a tear at one important point in the book, when you read it you will know which part I mean. Totally exquisite, would love to see this adapted on screen. Now I know why it has five stars, I feel a bit lost now I‚Äôve finished it, I could of kept reading. Wonderful.

title: Wonderful Book but takes a while to get going
text_review: This is a very special and unusual bookBeautifully written and very descriptive.  I don't usually like too much description but for this book it is essential and explains many aspects of the main character.It takes at least 25% to get going with the main story line so don't be put off by the lack of action.  It all comes together and is worth the timeA book that shall stay with me a long time.  Highly recommend

title: Absolutely wonderful
text_review: The most moving book I‚Äôve ever read.  Very cleverly written.  The author's descriptions are so powerful throughout, one can visualise the people, the area, the home and its contents, the beaches, the boats, woodland, and most of all Kya as a young girl and when she‚Äôs older.  A handy box of tissues is a necessity but saying that it‚Äôs a beautiful story.

title: Unique
text_review: Loved this book so much I was sad when I finished it! Really unusual and not at all mawkish; given the subject matter this could have been a temptation for the author and the book is much the better for her not falling into that trap. I really got a sense of place and time from the novel, once I had begun to understand that Carolinian drawl! Totally recommend this book.

title: Truly lovely
text_review: This book has been recommended constantly by lots of people and features in plenty of Top 10 lists. .. this quite often puts me off books and I confess I've waited ages before picking it up.  However, it's a beautifully written story, rich in description & the feel of the area and its history. I really enjoyed the book and am definitely adding it to my 'will read again' list

title: I was hooked from the very first confident sentence "Marsh is not swamp" . By the end of this romantic love song to wilderness and nature you'll understand why. The puny girl Kya becomes a wily teenager and finally an independent adult. It's a fascinating study of human nature in adversity, peopled with kind and cruel characters. Great read.
text_review: I was hooked from the first confident sentence "Marsh is not swamp". By the end of this romantic I've song to wilderness and nature you'll understand why. Puny Kya clings to hope as a child when one by one her supports leave. She grows older and more resourceful, but lonely and wary. Reliable love is tantalisingly just out of reach. Great story.

title: Such a moving tale
text_review: I could not stop reading this, hour after hour, the desire to know more about Kya, to find out what would happen to her. The description of the marshes and the wildlife existing there took me to another place.I wept for her, I rejoiced with her and I forgave her.A perfect story, and, as this is only her first novel, I hope that there will be more to come.

title: Excellent storyline and amazing description
text_review: A brilliant story line with a very interesting themes including isolation and survival. Amazing images painted with incredible descriptions of the story's setting and interests of the main character. The biology themes were cleverly interwoven with each scene and images evoked by the writer. One of my favourite  books so far in our book club.

title: Brought out my maternal side
text_review: Right from the very beginning I wanted to bring Kya home to love and care for her. It breaks my heart to know that this is a work of fiction but could so easily be a true story. This is a beautifully written book and I could visualise the settings, the sea, the boat, Jumpin's marina, I could smell the smells and hear the sounds. Brilliant.

title: Loved this so much
text_review: I loved this book.. It's beautiful and heartbreaking .  The wonderful walk in nature that the main characters take us on and the cruelty of most of the humans surrounding her. Jumpin and Mabel how real and human. I loved the characters so much. I was totally immersed in this and cried when characters were lost.  I think this will stay with me for a long while

title: So beautifully written you could visualise everything like you lived there with the characters!
text_review: Am amazing book with so many twists and turns. It held me , and pushed me to predict what was going to happen and just when I thought I knew, it took off in another direction. Beautifully writen, with an underlying message on this day with a 'black lives matter'  movement active and a very clear message of karma. So many times being reminded - 'what goes round comes round'!

title: Incredibly moving
text_review: This book was recommended to me by a friend. Not the sort of book I would normally read but I'm so glad I did.From the very start you feel the loneliness of this little girl, rejected by her community who survives the loss of her whole family and actually thrives. The author uses such beautiful language to describe her world and her feelings about her precious marsh.A beautifully crafted book, I would highly recommend it, and keep a box of tissues nearby!

title: Great page turner - definitely a must read
text_review: Having looked at the mixed reviews i decided to give this book a try. It was in no way slow or a disappointment.This book really introduces you to a different world of life in the swamps of Carolina.The story was captivating as we follow the life of Kyla the Marsh Girl and the reality of living in the 1960 and 70s.I would highly recommend this book.

title: Speechless.
text_review: I heard alot of reviews about this book and thought why not. I wasn't disappointed this is set against two time lines but it was such an easy read. You are drawn in from the very beginning - as cliche as it is I really couldn't put this book down I needed to know what happens.The plot, the writing style and characters were brilliant.

title: Where the Crawdads Sing.
text_review: What a hauntingly beautiful story.  Not enough superlatives to describe how much I loved this book.  Intense observation of human characteristics, and deep understanding of emotion.  Totally believable characters who let you experience, love, loneliness, fear, strength and joy.  It moved me in so many ways.  I really look forward to reading more by Delia Owen.

title: A page turning read
text_review: I have not read a book for a long time that I enjoyed as much as this one.  I really wanted to get to the end to find out what happened.  Very well written and so very different.  I would thoroughly recommend this book, for a summer read or just bedtime reading.  The colours and wild life of the Marsh was brought to life on paper.

title: Excellent with a small but...
text_review: It would be churlish to give this anything less than a 5 star review. It starts well. beautifully written and really takes you to the locale and into the character.Somewhere in the middle it shows signs of dropping into a chic-lit, but fairly quickly recovers. After the leisurely pace of almost the whole novel, the ending suddenly gobbles up the decades and all the loose ends become a bit too neat and tidy.A nice final twist.

title: A beautiful read
text_review: I was initially put off this book as I tend to read the poor reviews first and I‚Äôm glad a friend recommended it to me. A lovely gentle, easy to read book with some poetry and magical descriptions of the marshes off the North Carolina coast and the wildlife that inhabits them. I felt I was there. An endearing heroine, a story of love and the lack of it, and a surprise ending. I was sorry to finish it and I know it will stay with me for a long time.

title: Beautiful and compelling
text_review: This book pulls you in with great characters, vivid setting and a plot that meanders and gallops in all the right places. It‚Äôs a perfect book for lockdown - about Kya, the marsh girl - who grows up alone after first her mother,then her siblings and then her father leave her. Growing up she loves two men and when one ends up dead the finger of guilt points to her. Beautifully written with soothing and seductive prose that will transport you to another time and place and keep you guessing to the end.

title: GREAT READ
text_review: After seeing the amount of reviews I decided to get this on my kindle. Must admit it took a couple of chapters to get into but then with the story emerging i needed to read this daily to see what happens next.Refreshing read as totally different to what I would normally read. Loved this book and would recommend it.

title: I loved it!
text_review: I LOVED this book. The writing is beautifully descriptive on the marshland and wildlife. But most importantly the characterisation is wonderful.  I loved Kya as if she were personal friend or family member. She is a strong, resilient woman and I'm going to miss her.

title: Brilliantly written
text_review: Sad, heart rendering at times, the struggle and torment of the family is wonderfully written. The story of how a young Kya survives and is supported by the real people of her community is beautifully captured. The prejudices and segregation of her society has been written about with compassion for all those characters in the book.

title: An excellent recommednation
text_review: This was recommended by an American friend as a wonderful read.  I can only agree with her.  Such beautifully written descriptions of not only the marsh and of the town and its people but the use of language brought to life all the characters.  Loved this book and highly recommend it.

title: One of my favourite books
text_review: The only sad thing i can say about this book is , now that i have read it, I wont have the experience of reading it for the first time again.  If this is a first novel for this author..... just wow.I have bought it for many friends and family and they all love it.... it has been two weeks since i read it and i am at a loss as to what to read next as it has raised the bar so high

title: A truly wondrous book!
text_review: I cannot recommend this book highly enough.  I do not think I have ever read anything like it - had me laughing, in tears and all the characters in the book are just, well wonderful.  Specially the lead character Kya...please buy it and read it and give it to friends....it was recommended to me by a friend in South Africa and I am soooooooo glad she did....leaves you wishing you could start it all over again....

title: Beautiful
text_review: I absolutely loved this book. The author's knowledge of the environment really comes through and as a biologist, environmentalist and all round nature lover, I genuinely really enjoyed reading this beautifully written book. If you're expecting a fast paced thriller/murder mystery, this is not the book for you. That is not why I read this book though - I read it for the nature aspect and can honestly say the descriptions of the marsh environment are incredible and make me want to live in the wild!

title: Brilliant page turner, couldn't put it down
text_review: We chose this for our book club read and nobody didn't like it so that's a good reason to read it! I found it hard to put down, even though the main character has a very hard life you rely feel her inner strength to survive. Lots of themes running through the book from prejudice and poverty to domestic violence so we had lots to discuss in our group. Very good read glad we chose it.

title: A book that will stay with me for a very long time.
text_review: I found this slow to get into, but ended up totally hooked. The descriptions are hauntingly beautiful and  the account of her early life heartbreakingly sad. Written in a matter of fact way though, so not dismal. A fascinating slice of a very different life to what most of us know. And what an ending. It is the sort of book one presses others to read so you can talk about it.

title: The author draws a picture of loneliness that is unsurpassed and shows the side of nature in the.onlookers in ways that we wish were not true  were not true
text_review: Reality erases the romantic notion that happy endings bring everyone together and the notion that a person so damaged could be miraculously transformed into the ‚Äònorm‚Äô of social graces would have belied who Kya had become - a beautiful normal human being reflecting the way life moulded her and her genuine heart.  The author reached into her own soul I‚Äôm sure in writing this novel

title: Great story,full of atmosphere
text_review: I loved this book , atmospheric. Well drawn characters . All set in an unforgiving landscape .albeit tempered with well  drawn pictures of wildlife. The main characters way of coping in  such circumstances is  so commendable and believable and the tension builds slowly during the course of the story.  Brilliantly done.I really enjoyed it!

title: Took my breath away
text_review: What an incredible book - I stayed up late into the night to finish it. There is such a beautiful depth of knowledge of the landscape and ecology of the marshlands underpinning this fresh story and this lends the book such a vibrancy and authenticity. The story is original, tender, unsettling and very poignant. I would not hesitate to recommend this breathtaking book.

title: Excellent read
text_review: Fantastic story leading us from the life of a little girl through to womanhood .  Left by her mother and siblings to fend for herself.  The descriptions of the marsh the birds and animals transported me there. To imagine loving someone and they leave you too.Then to love someone who was not trustworthy was sad.  Great ending too.

title: Unlike anything I have read before...
text_review: This is the story of a young girl who when abandoned by her family, survives. We follow her struggles to feed herself, buy essentials, learn to read, mature into womanhood and most of all to learn to trust other people when all she has ever know is people abandoning her.The writing is excellent and creates such a vivid picture of the marshes that you get completely drawn in.

title: Could not put this book down.
text_review: I was gripped from the first page of this wonderful book - a murder mystery set in the marshlands of North Carolina, but the murder is more of a sub plot than the main story. A fractured family, a strange girl who the townspeople dislike for being "other" and living on the marshes. It explores prejudice, resilience, loyalty and the nature of true friendship.I couldn't wait for the ending, but at the same time, didn't want it to end.Highly recommended.

title: Best read for a long time
text_review: Beautifully written, the story unfolds slowly and in delicious detail. The small details of Kya‚Äôs life are minutely and sensitively set out, but never become uninteresting. I really felt I wanted to know more about her as she became a heroine I deeply cared about. In the story, a catastrophe occurs and I cannot recall having felt so anxious about the outcome of a book for many years. Thoroughly recommended.

title: Oh My Goodness This is Incredible
text_review: This book is absolutely amazing,the description takes you there into the swamp. It tells a child‚Äôs and woman‚Äôs struggle against prejudice of a community and her true love of her wonderful environment .It is impossible to realise what an absolute gem this book is until you get to the point when you can‚Äôt put it down.This is so much more than a great read, it‚Äôs a life changer excellent .Thank you Delia Owens

title: LOVED it but a few reservations...
text_review: Generally I loved this book and read it very quickly. There are mostly short chapters which suits me and the style of writing is very easy to get through. I loved that the story took you through Kya‚Äôs whole life and she is probably one of my favourite protagonists in a book ever. I loved her! There are plot holes which are highlighted in other reviews however if the author had included it all then the book would be about 3000 pages long! It‚Äôs a work of fiction! Anyway, I loved it the whole way through however unfortunately the ended devastated me. Not because it was badly written but because I had SOOOO many questions left unanswered and personally for me I like books to be tied up in a neat little bow. That being said, it wouldn‚Äôt put me off recommending it. Well worth the read I thoroughly enjoyed it (mostly).

title: I loved every word
text_review: I‚Äôve never read anything quite like this. The setting was original and imaginatively created. I felt and breathed it. The central character was unusual but easy to identify with. It was interesting to read literature with a scientific bias.Descriptions were powerful, handling of language was delicate

title: Beautifully written
text_review: I had been looking forward to sitting down with this one for a couple of weeks, but I really couldn't get into it at first, I had a bad few days with self isolation madness (its officially a thing) and couldn't concentrate.  It probably took me 4 days to read the first 100 pages but after that I was gripped and wow.So beautifully written and with such amazing detail, the end had me in tears.  I am so glad I persevered, I nearly didn't as not all reviews are great, so stick with it if like me you found it slow going.

title: Breathtaking
text_review: I can't remember the last time I read a book so captivating from start to finish.  Gently draws you in and completely immerses you into the world of Kya, the main character.  So vivid I actually cried at one point and couldn't read fast enough until I realised I was nearly at the end and then needed to read more slowly as I did not want it to end!  The only thing I felt a bit cheated by was the skimming over of the details at the end of the book when I wanted to know more but I just filled in the blanks myself and spent a long time after the book ended daydreaming about the possibilities.  I look forward to seeing this come to the screen.

title: A wonderful book
text_review: Beautifully written this is an engaging story of a girl growing up in a remote part of America, ostracised and misunderstood by the local community, how she survives ,how she learns to love and is betrayed, and how she finally achieves recognition.  There is an intriguing mystery element as well which adds to the story.  A really good read.

title: The most beautifully written book in a long while.
text_review: Immediately I fell in love with Kya and her affinity with nature ,  it was breath taking!  The story of rejection and survival was heart  breaking and inspiring. The support characters were apt and believable. I guessed the ending secret long before the end, Maya  was taught by nature .I will read it again and again!

title: The crawdads sing loudly in this novel.
text_review: Delia Owens wrote this lovely novel with a paint brush rather than a pen.  Her descriptive writing is so evocative that that when she describes Kya standing in the marsh, you feel the water splashing around your feet and the mud between your toes while hearing the sounds of the primeval seashore.This is a story of love discovered, lost and found again against a backdrop of solitude, unhappiness, rejection, and a passionate love of animals, plants and untamed nature.Recommended wholeheartedly to anyone with a glimmer of sentimentality in their hearts.

title: Heart rending!
text_review: I found this book a wee bit slow to start and almost gave up after the first chapter.  I almost wish I had.  A heartbreakingly sad tale that will play on my mind for a long time.  I can‚Äôt remember the last time I rooted so desperately for a character or when I felt so much gratitude towards a cat.  I‚Äôm looking forward to her next book.

title: If you are into this type of books you will like it
text_review: The overall subject is appealing though initially the book is written in a quite heavy english and a lot of southern dialects which if you are not familiar with makes it really hard to read.Somewhere in the middle of the book the overall story becomes so hard to believe that it spoils the reading pleasure. It is a fiction book but still should have a scent of probability to happen in life as is not a SF book. For me is the type of book that you do not buy you borrow from a friend.

title: Amazing and simply un-putdownable! If there is one book to read this year!
text_review: Wow, what a page-turner from start to finish! I just couldn't put it down despite having purchased it during a holiday break in the UK. Love the author's writing style and the story-line

title: A sweet rags to riches story
text_review: This book is a rare choice  for me because it wasn't for a book club. The characters were well developed and even the drunkard father became more tolerable once his war secret was shared. I thought the ending arrived abruptly. The final chapter could have been padded out. It's still a sweet and believable story.

title: Nicely written, drawn out
text_review: I felt the hype about this book wasn't justified.  I did enjoy it, more towards the end, as I found the beginning somewhat boring, it is well written, no doubt but not a book I couldn't put down. Nice twist in the end, could have done without all the poems and a little more suspense.

title: A very beautiful book...
text_review: Beautifully written, a great story very well told. In fact, when I got to the last third I read solidly for five hours as I had to know the end.A great first novel very descriptively written that I could see, hear and smell the marsh and Kya's surroundings.A great first novel, I hope she writes more.

title: Marvellous saga!
text_review: I normally steer clear of American fiction, but this was drawn to my attention by a former relative. What a surprise indeed! This ranks as a superb piece of fiction, beautifully set out. I feel as though as I was there, on the marshes with Kay and Tate. It did seem rather obvious that Kay had killed the odious Chase, but never mind. I have experienced a wonderful story.

title: Brilliant book!
text_review: Thoroughly enjoyed this book. Beautifully written, wonderful descriptions, characters you can empathise with (not that I have ever lived on a swamp!) and a very good pace to the story. A page turner in that you wanted to know what happened next but also one that you didn't want to end as you were so engrossed in the place and time.

title: Loved this book, brought me through 10 emotions in a day
text_review: The ending of this book was difficult to read as I had to keep on wiping the tears away.  It was a book full of melancholy, euphoria, learning, eagerness, youth, faith....  I could go on,  it was really a terrific read that brought me through each of the emotions with the growing up of Kya and all that she learns along the way.  It highlights the cruelty of people but also the kindness of others.

title: A joy to read
text_review: This book is beautifully written and you are easily transported into Kya's mesmerizing yet brutal world. I was left cheering for the underdog through the twists and turns. Kya and her life are reminiscent of a Disney film. Read it in a few days as I couldn't put it down. Thoroughly recommend this book.

title: Couldn't put it down
text_review: I read this book as it had been recommended by several people. And justly so.I started reading it and the only reason I put it down was because I was in the middle of decorating! I made tea with it in one hand.The characters and the descriptions have you there. No spoilers.  Just read it.

title: Unusual theme, gripping story
text_review: This is an amazing book with a denouement that you may not see coming.  Beautifully & thoughtfully written, the heroine is an unusual child with a 'different' lifestyle who grows up into an unusual woman taking advantage of the 'strangeness' of her environs. A brilliant read that stays in the mind for a long time.

title: Excellent book. I strongly recommend it
text_review: Brilliant book. I wasn‚Äôt sure about the subject matter when I read the back cover of the book. However it was fantastic and I really felt I knew the lead character so well. I couldn‚Äôt wait to read another section and was sad when it all ended. The descriptions of the scenery were excellent. The only negative is that the ending with a lot of intervening years seemed very rushed But that is a small thing.

title: A must read!
text_review: I only started reading this book as it came up as a popular read on Amazon. I downloaded the sample and didn't expect to be drawn in and captivated by this marvellous storytelling.  I can honestly say I have never read anything like it. The way the author weaves a tale of the beauty of nature with murder and abandonment is remarkable. Although there is brutality in the narrative, the author has somehow managed to preserve the beauty and joy of nature. The characters evoke empathy and emotion whilst retaining depth and intrigue. Fabulous book that I thourghly enjoyed reading and couldn't put down. Look forward to reading more by this author.

title: Beautifully written book
text_review: This book is not one I would pick up usually, but our book club decided to have it. Once I started it I was hooked. A death, a life, interlinked by the natural surroundings and circumstances.  A lead character so well drawn that I was sucked into her world right from the start. The prose is beautifully crafted, and very moving in parts, and an end that takes your breath away. Cann't recommend it highly enough.

title: Fantastic best read for ages
text_review: I could not put this book down. It has been years since I read something this good. I still keep thinking about it. I appreciate the way it is written and enjoy the way the author has described the surroundings. Not only did I feel like I really knew the marsh I felt I knew all the characters by the end. Thank you

title: Wonderful rich setting for a beautifully told story
text_review: An unusual story with a very particular setting by a writer who is obviously very knowledgeable about this environment and has a great affinity to it too. Although it gets off to a slow start I was very soon hooked and remained so until the final page. One to savour.

title: The marsh girls tale
text_review: A beautiful story written with love and sadness - wonderful descriptions of a young girls haunting struggles against nature and society. The descriptions are compelling and the end is as it should be.  Chases death is a relief and the way he died a measure of justice for the horrors he inflicted on his victim!!

title: Loved loved loved it!
text_review: Reviewers seem very divided on this book.  I had no idea what to expect as I didn't read the reviews beforehand.  It therefore took me by surprise and I fell in love with its gentle tone and the sway of the Marsh.  I was rooting for Kya throughout, and had my heart in mouth at the trial.  I could visualise the characters and felt I got to know them, which is the heart of a good work of fiction for me.I hope the film does the stunning descriptive powers of nature in this book justice.

title: Great read including interesting characters. Left me wanting more!
text_review: There‚Äôs was nothing about this book that I disliked. I loved this book and will definitely read it again at some point. I loved the characters, I liked how discrimination was quietly but clearly acknowledged within the book and for the first time I was ok with the main character leaving things unsaid. Wonderfully written, easy to read, great references to nature. Left me wanting more.

title: Beautiful and lush
text_review: I always feel dubious of books that are so strongly recommended and reviewed by all. Crawdads is a book of beauty, stillness and all at one with nature; a girl abandoned by her family and grows up separate from the human world and at one with nature.  It is very well written and the words flow and are luscious slow and meandering like the area where Kya lives (almost remind me of Porgy &Bess)  Read with a southern accent in your head for maximum effect but most importantly read and enjoy

title: Wonderful story!
text_review: This is one of those books that you start reading slowly half way through because you don‚Äôt want it to end! Yes, of course there are certain aspects which are not wholly believable, but this is fiction. Suspend your disbelief and get lost in this beautifully written and engaging story.

title: incredible read
text_review: The details and knowledge and research that has gone into this story is so impressive. I read it in 4 nights could not put it down . A really enjoyable tale with twist and turns , it really put you through lots of emotions , as you go through the book. A book to definitely recommend , and to read again.

title: Have recommended to friends.
text_review: I can understand some other readers comments that the story is too unbelievable for them however I think a certain degree of imagination if required. It's not necessarily a true to life story but rather more of a fantasy. If you don't get too hung up on the smaller insignificant details (how could a young child survive in a swap on her own and not get sick and no one helps her out etc) then the book is a beautifully descriptive story and immerses the reader in a world of 1950s north carolina swamp marshes, coming of age in isolation and love and loss. The story was not as predictable as I thought it would be (I had an idea in my mind of how I thought it would end). A far as escapism goes, it's a good read.

title: My favourite book of the year (after reading a lot!)
text_review: I read this early in 2020 and have read lots of books since due to lockdown. Along with American Dirt it‚Äôs the most memorable book of the year and my overall favourite. If you like it you will probably like Crow Lake (Mary Lawson) which I‚Äôve just finished and is a similarly lovely story with interesting, likeable characters that feel real.

title: A story to feed your soul !
text_review: Loved this . If you want something different to read I thoroughly recommend the tale of Kya the marsh girl. Beautifully written and absorbing its a totally different world that she inhabits but not in any futuristic or science fiction way so don‚Äôt be put off. It‚Äôs about her life from beginning to an end that leaves you breathless. You won‚Äôt be disappointed

title: Inspiring thought provoking novel
text_review: Thank you Delia Owens for writing this book. It was thought provoking and engaging. When the Crawdads Sing has been on my tbr for a while and now that I'm finished it I'm really pleased I have read it but desolate that I have read it. I found this book thought provoking and different. Delia Owens portrays Kyas world in such wonderful detail, I will never look at a bird feather in the same way. I wish I had this book to read for the first time and would wholeheartedly recommend itüòä

title: Wonderful
text_review: Unique story that pulls you in and makes you worry for the main character while admiring her at the same time. Plot moves along nicely and the descriptions paint an evocative scene. Loved it. Sad to see it end!

title: Kept my interest to the very end.
text_review: This book was chosen by the reading go up I am part of. I must admit I wasn't sure  I would be interested,  but I was pleasantly surprised.  Really enjoyed the descriptions of the wild marsh and all it's inhabitants. Felt l got to know the character's really well. Very enjoyable .

title: Wonderful storytelling, beautifully written.
text_review: I am not usually interested in long descriptions, but the descriptive writing in this book is wonderful; it takes the reader right into the town, swamp and into Kya‚Äôs life. The reader identifies with Kya‚Äôs emotions, and all the characters are beautifully drawn. By far the best book I have read in a long time.

title: Beautiful read
text_review: I am loving this book. We are reading it for book club. It is beautifully written- so descriptive. The story is intriguing and while the start is sad the strength and resilience of the heroine is remarkable. We will have plenty to discuss. Loving learning about the marshlands too

title: A beautifully written compelling read.
text_review: This book not only drew the reader in, with its twists and turns of the plot, but it also contained the most evocative descriptions of the nature of marshlands.  The detailed descriptions of the natural landscapes brought to life the flora and fauna of the marsh.  Thus the story flowed seamlessly along and was given an enhanced depth due to the backdrop depiction of the marsh, this aspect was a delight.  Moreover, the book was an undeniable page turner, difficult to put down.  I was really sorry to have finished it.

title: One sitting!
text_review: Tried my best to read this in one sitting but failed as I needed sleep. It‚Äôs been a long time since writing of this quality has enthralled me. The author has written about a very unfamiliar landscape to me and brought it alive. Wonderful main character, heart wrenching and beautiful all at once. No wonder this is a best seller.

title: Fab read
text_review: This is a great novel and one that you can‚Äôt put down. It is beautifully written and when I read it I was transported to wherever the author wanted me to be. Loved it!

title: Simply Brilliant!!
text_review: OMG ....what can I say about this book that hasn't been said before. The story of a young girl who has been abandoned by everyone she has ever known or loved and how others perceive her. This is one of those books that will stay in my heart and head for a very long time. Everyone should read it....but be ready with the tissues

title: Enthralling, moving story of rejection, loneliness and the redemptive power of nature
text_review: I loved this beautiful novel which had such an original storyline.  It is full of amazing descriptions of nature, some of them written as poetry - the marshland is such an atmospheric background to this story of abandonment, rejection and loneliness.  The author's love of birdlife and nature runs through every page.  The story of Kya is engrossing and heartbreaking in parts.  The unexplained death and subsequent murder enquiry adds a thrilling, foreboding element to the book making it almost impossible to put down.

title: Rather disappointing.
text_review: I‚Äôm not a great whodunnit fan but was initially engaged by the plot, until I began to wonder what audience the novel was aimed at: children abandoned by their parents is a ploy used from Dickens to Rowling. The love interest was starkly contrasted and as the final pages turned the resolution did not come as a great surprise.

title: A wonderful book
text_review: I was captivated by this story from the first page. Seeing the strange and otherworldly swampland through the eyes of a child made it seem very real. The strong character of Kya was so well drawn that I could believe she survived alone to adulthood . I lived through every hardship with her and shared the beauty of the birds and landscape she loved.The last few chapters were nail biting and the final unveiling of the truth was completely unexpected.I found it reminiscent in parts of Harper Lee‚Äôs To Kill a Mockingbird.

title: Brilliantly written
text_review: This story transported me to unknown territory, but by the end of the book it was familiar and comforting. Carefully drawn characters , each one individual and unique, telling the most original murder mystery one could wish for.I would wholeheartedly recommend this book.

title: Out on the marsh
text_review: A really lovely story about a girl abandoned to a lonely life on the marsh. Her development and how she overcame everything to be a well known author of marsh life. A bit of a whodunit as well.  The story hooks you in and let's you live with Kya in her habitat.  Excellent.

title: Beautiful writting
text_review: Not only does this novel grip both the heart and the mind with a well crafted story addressing many topics , including a murder investigation.It's is so beautifully written, with just the right amount of fine detail.If recommend this fascinating book every time

title: Atmospheric and beautiful. A great debut novel.
text_review: This book drew me in after the first few initial pages. Quite detailed in it's description of the marsh land and habitat it is almost like a non-fiction book to start with but then the story unfolds. I like the fact that it is quite slow paced and full of atmospheric description of a place I have never visited. I really liked and admired the main character.  A book that stays with you long after you have finished the last page.

title: Excellent read!
text_review: This was a really good story and kept me hooked.  The ending has a great and unexpected twist (though it‚Äôs not a thriller!).  I see it‚Äôs in the fiction charts in my latest Saturday Times Culture and Review supplement - well deserved in my opinion.  Buy it for an unusual story!

title: Stunning Story, Beautifully Written
text_review: A stunning tale about Nature, natural and human, and how they inextricably weave together. It is a beautifully and evocatively written bittersweet tale that will live with me for a very long time. This is a near-perfect novel, and quite the best have read in a very long time. I can not recommend it highly enough.

title: Couldn't put it down
text_review: It was a bit of a slow burner but once I got into it, I couldn't put this book down. I think some of the reviews here are too harsh. The author takes you into another world, one that really connects you with nature and does so with such detailed knowledge you can picture it all so clearly. I felt really drawn to kya and loved seeing her journey and blossom through her hardships, along with the help of some lovely characters and acts of real kindness.

title: A must read.
text_review: When I finally had the chance to pick this book up to read I couldn't put it downThe author has such talent in describing every detail of the marsh so much so I could almost smell the damp moss and mud.The story is compelling and I can't wait to see what more this author will produce.

title: A wonderful first novel.
text_review: A gripping tale of swamp life and a girl who rises above her circumstances - given the added impetus of being a detective story which brings out the prejudice and snobbery of life in the Louisiana swamp lands. I enjoyed the book enormously and believe that as a first novel it promises great things for the future. Strongly recommended.

title: Absoloutly brilliant
text_review: I loved all of this book. The story of abandonment and resilience, along with some love, hate, despair and nature. I loved the way the nature of insects, plants, birds and everything was matched with human behaviour. The ending was a bit of a surprise in some ways but felt right.

title: A great read.
text_review: A very moving story of a young girl's abandonment by her family and her survival.  Despite being mocked and shunned by most of the local community, a few people help her survive into adulthood in the natural world of the marshes where was born.  The detailed descriptions of nature and it's cycles and how she interacted with them were fascinating. The characters were well drawn and I felt I really knew them by the end. The many difficulties and loneliness she faced were balanced with some years of happiness later in her life. The  twist at the end was quite unexpected.

title: Pish
text_review: I‚Äôm not sure why I ended up buying this novel. Perhaps because it was a Sunday Times best seller. Alas, I was duped. It‚Äôs pish. Mills and Boone for the middle class. It‚Äôs literature,  it not as we know it. Shakespeare will turn in his grave.

title: Implausible story line but page turning
text_review: Firstly I loved the book, such beautifully drawn characters and I have been to North Carolina and kayaked along the rivers  so totally could imagine the scene - but it was almost implausible to believe a young child could survive alone in the swamps - but hey ho it is a story. The tender help of the fabulous Jumpin' and his wife - brought tears to my eyes.

title: Wonderful
text_review: I bought this book ages ago as a Kindle Daily Deal but never actually got round to reading it. During this heatwave, sitting on the deck of our narrowboat, I have devoured it, have found myself totally immersed to the point nothing else got done. Honestly if you only read one book this year, make it this one.

title: Short on plot
text_review: More of a nature book than a novel.  Beautiful descriptions of the marsh but very little plot.  One of those books where I am clearly in tne minority who didn't love It.

title: A wonderful book
text_review: The first thing about this book that caught my eye was the title. It spoke to me because as a child I had been born in South Carolina and crawdads were where everywhere. As I began to read this wonderful novel, memories of my childhood flooded back to me. I did not live the life of Kay‚Äôs but it surrounded me as a child. Moving on from that, I became enchanted with the main character,her gentleness, her courage, her resilience and fortitude. I won‚Äôt give away the plot, but will tell you that I could not put it down. One of the best books I have read in a long time.

title: Wonderful
text_review: This was a choice for my local book club, not a book I would normally choose to read but so glad I did. Against all odds a child survives by herself, finds a friend who helps her in many ways. Quite a few twists along the way, not a book to easily put down. Please read, you won't regret it.

title: A truly original read
text_review: I loved this book and read it in record time as I just couldn't put it down.  It is exquisitely written and gives a wonderful picture of the North Carolina marshes and their wildlife, and that's apart from the human element, which in itself is completely compelling and beautiful.  I cried as I finally finished reading it.  A real must read.

title: Great page turner
text_review: I loved this book and I can't really describe why!  It was such a change of pace from many of the thrillers I've read recently, but it totally captivated me.  The setting in the swamp was so vividly described and Kya was so brave and resourceful, I just wanted to keep reading to make sure that she would stay safe in her very unconventional world. It's a great story and I highly recommend it!

title: A masterpiece in depicting the cruelty of exclusion and the beauty of perseverance.
text_review: I thoroughly enjoyed this book. The title put me off at first as I didn‚Äôt know what a ‚Äòcrawdad‚Äô was. It was an easy read that I found hard to put down and when I did, I couldn‚Äôt wait to get back to it. Although I have no personal experience of the setting, I felt as if I was there in the marshes. Beautifully written! I definitely recommend it.

title: Great book
text_review: I'd never read this author before but was engrossed in this story before many pages were turned.  It was so original, so completely different from anything I've read before I found myself having great difficulty closing it. Will look for other stories by this writer.

title: I only keep books I know I'll read again ...
text_review: I first read this brilliant book on my phone (in 2 days thanks to the world being in lockdown). As I know I'll want to re read it I've just ordered an actual book for my forever book shelf. I loved every page and cried at the end, not just for the wonderful characters and a story I never wanted to end, but because I had literally finished the book. Delia Owens please write some more novels soon. And finally, thank you for a brief magical escape into the marshlands with Kya.

title: One of the best books I‚Äôve ever read
text_review: I just loved this book from beginning to end. The description of life on the marshes,  Kya‚Äôs difficult existence there but also the beauty of her discoveries, the love story, the intrigue are all interwoven into this beautiful story. Just so sad I‚Äôve finished it. A tale that will stay with me forever.

title: superb
text_review: probably one of the best novels I have read in recent years. A gripping storyline and plot, finely drawn characters.  Intriguing descriptions of natural habitats, addressing prejudices and attitudes relevant to today.I won't forget it for a long time and recommend you give it a try!

title: An instant classic
text_review: I loved every part of this book. From the poetic style of writing, the magical way it takes you right into the marsh lands and the heart breaking raw story.  It will have you in tears but you will forgive the author because she ultimately took you to another world that is oh so beautiful.  My favourite book of all time.

title: I could not put this down!
text_review: I absolutely loved this book. Beautifully written, it made me fall in love with the marsh landscape in which it is set. I found it more of a page turner than anything I have read for a long time, with mystery and twists right up to The end. The only thing that annoyed me slightly about it was the rather clich√©d descriptions of the predictably beautiful protagonist. Not, however, annoying enough to lose a star over! The images conjured up by this book will stay with me a long time. I can't wait for Delia Owens' next novel.

title: Now what will I do?
text_review: Read this book during the Covid lockdown.  It is such a good book.  The descriptions of the marsh and the wildlife are so evocative and real.  I love books which are strongly anchored in place.  Plus a moving story that said much about isolation, struggle and how people are easily regarded as bring ‚Äòother‚Äô.  Highly recommended!

title: A fabulous read!
text_review: Lots of books are excellent but every now and then an exceptional book comes along.  Where the Crawdads Sing is one of these. Very well written, wonderfully descriptive, heartbreaking and keeps you hooked.  I am nearing its conclusion as I write this -  I am looking forward to seeing how it ends but at the same time wish it would carry on.

title: It will be an enduring favourite book
text_review: This wonderful book seems to have everything- well drawn characters, splendid descriptions of a very unique area,  exploration of loneliness, prejudice, survival and very importantly suspense.  It‚Äôs the sort of book you can‚Äôt possibly skim read, every word is vital.  I loved it.

title: Tenderly expressed tense and harsh story a life supported by nature and love.
text_review: Beautifully written story of a resilient forlorn abandoned but resilient child, who grows to discover her love and passion for the nature around her and how that helps her understand her community and herself. Tense up until the last page, with an ending I hoped for.

title: A-MAZ-ING
text_review: This is a beautiful novel.I found it a little difficult to get into but, oh wow! Once I did...The characters are so drawn so deeply. The story is intriguing until it becomes agonising.I love this book. It‚Äôs a modern classic.

title: Beautiful
text_review: I haven't finished a book in so long but this blew me away and I couldn't put it down. As a lover of nature, it drew me in, and I think it will take a long time to stop thinking about it. The characters are unforgettable. I so hope the author will write more fiction books, as a first, this is sublime.

title: An unforgettable masterpiece
text_review: I can‚Äôt even describe how much I love this book and am in awe of how beautifully it‚Äôs written. Where the Crawdads Sing is truly incredible from start to finish and our whole book club have been left astounded by its sheer brilliance.The only conclusion I can find to these handful of bad reviews is a lack of both heart and imagination. I‚Äôm all for everyone having an opinion but for people to say this novel is ‚Äòutter rubbish‚Äò, ‚Äòunrealistic‚Äô or ‚Äòlacking‚Äô is simply baffling and downright rude.Extremely excited for the film though it‚Äôs hard to see how it will do this book justice! X

title: Boring as hell!
text_review: Over-rated, over-hyped and boring as absolute hell!

title: Exceptional I every way
text_review: Remarkable story, really well told. Convincing characters and a final twist. The descriptions of the environment, the emotions and desires are beautiful, dramatic and poetic.It is a story of survival against all the odds, a love story and a murder mystery. Loved this book.

title: Breathtakingly beautiful book.
text_review: A joy to read from the first sentence to the last. A rich, fluidly written novel with such emotional depth. Stunning descriptions of the marsh landscape that is Kya‚Äôs whole world. Touching portrait of a little girl, abandoned one by one by her family and how she survived prejudice, deprivation and the hands of the law, ultimately to flourish and fall in love. This is a book that will linger in my memory.

title: Highly recommend, beautifully written and compelling.
text_review: My favourite genre to read is crime, I bought this book because of its allusion to a mystery and because I thought it would be something a bit different to what I usually read. I‚Äôm so glad I bought it because it‚Äôs now my favourite book. It‚Äôs beautifully written and through the detailed description of nature and the marshes I could clearly picture it in my head, it became a beautiful escape from boring isolation life. It‚Äôs heartbreaking, sometimes uncomfortable with reference to abuse but overall beautiful and compelling. The element of crime and murder is present however doesn‚Äôt dominate the book. Owens creates a well rounded developed character of Kya, I felt connected to her even though we had nothing in common. Highly recommend this book.

title: Not an Engaging Read
text_review: I kept expecting something to happen and it never did.  Also unbelievable about the main character.  Dragged up so who taught her to be clean and brush her teeth etc when she was on her own from such an early age, or does she? Boring and not believable.  Would n't recommend unless you like wildlife, in which case read a book on wild life.

title: Beautiful
text_review: Loved this book from start to finish, the writing was magical, you felt like you were with Kya, like you were watching her grow from the marsh reeds where she watched. One of the most moving books I have read in a while.

title: The most beautiful book I have read in years <3
text_review: Recommended by a good friend; the first chapter left me a little concerned this was just going to be a flowery, fluffy book full of wonderful, descriptive narrative regarding the location of the main characters' world.  Persevere and you will be captivated by this fabulous tale and the beautiful writing style. Left me feeling blessed to have had the chance to read it!

title: Not just a murder mystery
text_review: I read this book in one day after finding myself unable to stop. I don't feel as though it's a light hearted book you can just pick up and put back down. It was a book that had me thinking and feeling many different emotions throghout. When I finished the book it actually took me time to think about what I thought of it. It wasn't an instant 'i loved that!' But after thinking about it, I realised how brilliant it was, how clever it was. It's not just a 'murder mystery' it's many other things. A book that speaks about murder and love yes, but a book that speaks about race, prejudice, judgement, nature and sexual assault. A book that actually makes you feel and think things.

title: Simply beautiful and a joy to the senses .  I would recommend this book to everyone who wishes to be taken on an emotional journey into the joy of nature and the strength of the human heart and soul .  It's a book that will live in my mind forever .  This is a story that will stand the test of time, there was nothing i disliked i just loved it all.  l
text_review: This is a story of abandonment ,love and ultimately deception. There was nothing i disliked i just loved it all.  It is a very rare memorable book that will stand the test of time.  It's magic is to draw you into the story whilst seeing and sensing the marshland it's set in.  It is simply a joy to read and I didn't want to put it down. I would recommend it to all lovers of quality storytelling with a plot that never fails to keep your attention

title: Emotive
text_review: Transports you to another place.  The characters are good.  The location is brought to life and made me want to visit.  An enjoyable read.  Highly recommended if you like good character driven books.  The pace is a little odd, it speeds up a lot towards the end but that didn't spoil it for me.

title: Couldn‚Äôt put the book down
text_review: I began this book at about 4pm after the post arrived. I physically could not put it down and stayed up until 6 am until I finished it. I felt I knew the characters so personally and had so many feelings for them all. Defiantly the best book I have ever read. Wish I could wipe my memory and read it again

title: Beautifully written but wanders too much
text_review: I have quite mixed feelings on this one. On the one hand, the description of the swamp and marshlands are really evocative and the story has a strong fable element to it, which I really liked. On the other, it did feel to me that it would have really benefitted from stronger editing because it wanders and gets somewhat repetitive at times. That said, I would still recommend it.

title: The marsh holds its secrets
text_review: A sweetly written book that traces the arc of a lonely and independent life. Left alone when she didn't want to be, Kya learns the hard way not to trust. Misunderstood, mistreated, yet she endures at one with the marsh around her. A carefully constructed book full of empathy, we want Kya not only to survive, but to love and be loved -- even when the world conspires to intrude.

title: A wonderful debut novel - well worth a read!
text_review: This book was recommended to me by my daughter after her book club had read it.An extremely well written story with a very detailed description of day-to-day life in the marsh lands of the North Carolina coast in the 1950's and 1960's. Wonderful descriptions of the wildlife and inhabitants of Barkely Cove where Kya Clark becomes a suspect when Chase Andrews is found dead. A murder mystery, coming-of-age story that explores the impact of loneliness and prejudice and keeps you guessing right up to the final pages.

title: Fantastic book and a must read
text_review: I was recommended this by a friend of mine and wasn‚Äôt sure about it when she was telling me the outline of the story but I downloaded a sample on my kindle as I said I would try it out. The book gripped me from the first paragraph and I literally  couldn‚Äôt put it down. The characters, writing and story are fantastic and the map at the beginning really helps to understand and picture things as the story goes on.  I got to the end and was disappointed I had finished it. I will definitely be reading this one again soon.

title: A wonderful read
text_review: I loved this book - I got lost in it, couldn't put it down yet didn't want to finish it. A love story, a story of hope...well worth reading.

title: Beautifully Written
text_review: This book was so easy to read and so beautiful to picture. Loved the imagery and personification throughout. I wanted to read it slowly just to take in every word! This was a perfect for one of those times where you just want to read a book that doesn't need too much brainpower yet also makes you think and make links quickly with chapters read or chapters to come. Would recommend it to anyone who loves descriptive language in novels as this is beautiful.

title: Combines the poignance and emotion of a literary novel with the suspense of a thriller.
text_review: This was a beautifully written book that draws you in immediately. Brilliant characterisation and wonderful descriptions of nature. The author cleverly weaves together carefully constructed characters, the natural surrounding and an enthralling plot, which is all the more gripping because of the emotional attachment we feel to the characters.

title: Heart breaking and beautiful
text_review: A young child Kya, deserted by her fractured family, collects mussels to stay alive. This is a wonderful story of loss , survival, exclusion, love and fighting wrongs. Beautifully written ,I have to admit to shedding a few tears. Highly recommend it.

title: A Beautiful Book - Better than expected
text_review: After reading poor reviews I dreaded reading this book.  But now I have read it I cannot understand those poor reviews.  It had me gripped very soon into the book and I remained entranced throughout.  A lovely poignant story book.  Just shows not to be lead by reviews.  I loved it and wish I hadn‚Äôt read it so fast.  5 Stars.

title: Well written and captivating
text_review: While the book is very well written and it is a captivating story, it is also a fantastical story and bares belief - small girl surviving on her own with no money and only little help by one good samaritan.  Nevertheless, I highly enjoyed the book.

title: One of the best books I have read in a long time
text_review: From page one I was engrossed. I am an avid reader and am never without a book to read. Some enjoyable some not so. There are a few that have got me into them from page one and Where The Crawdads Sing is one of them. I haven't quite finished it but will be sorry when I do.

title: Stretched Credibility.
text_review: Some of the descriptive passages are good but the story takes some believing.  The characters are one-dimensional; the goodies are good and the baddies are bad.  This was our book club book otherwise I would have taken note of other reviews and not bothered to read it.

title: An enchanting read
text_review: An enchanting story about a young girl left to raise herself in the marshes intertwines with a murder mystery set several years later.  The two stories dance around each other until they eventually collide and bring the book to a satisfying finish.  Despite the neat twist at the end not feeling quite right, it is a tale which will stay with me for some time.

title: Beautiful
text_review: I read this a few weeks ago and didn‚Äôt expect much having not heard the hype. But oh boy it certainly lives up to expectation. I can‚Äôt put my finger on why this story has stuck with me and I cannot stop thinking about it... possibly the setting, or the main character who was so likeable and simply written. Whatever it was I adore this book and have already recommended it to many people.

title: Brilliant!
text_review: I love this book!  Though unspeakable things take place, it is written so gently, so lovingly.  Then unexpectedly it becomes a mystery about which I came to needed to know  more. Then It became a page turner.  And finally I simply couldn't put it down.

title: Excellent read.
text_review: This was my book clubs choice for January, I loved the story immensely I was not sure at the beginning, it was not long before it grabbed me even had me in tears, to the point the ending surprised me but on reflection perhaps not, get reading folks.

title: Marsh Girl
text_review: Marvellous ! A story that has stunning scenery, poetry and a perfect plot. My favourite novel of 2019 and ideal of bookclub discussion. How lucky we are to have an author of such singular talent to write for us. Everything about ‚ÄòWhere the Crawdads sing‚Äô is a marvel. A ‚Äò must read.‚Äô

title: Couldn't put it down!
text_review: I'd heard good things about this book so decided to give it a go. I'm particular with my book choices as i have very little spare time to read (sadly) but this book did not disappoint. Beautifully written, compelling and heartbreakingly wonderful. If you read one book this year, make it this one!

title: Beautifully written.
text_review: Vivid and detailed descriptions of the wildlife and environment  - you feel you are there- provide the backdrop to this poignant story of a young girl abandoned to fend for herself in the swamp lands of North Carolina. I enjoyed every moment of this book.

title: Excellent read
text_review: This story is about Kya ‚Äòthe marsh girl‚Äô.  Her life in the marshes after she was one by one abandoned by her family. A poignant story of her life and her affinity with nature and her triumph over adversity . Highly recommended an excellent read.

title: The landscape wins.
text_review: I suppose, being very critical, some of the lesser characters are pretty one dimensional but I don't really care because the main character, the landscape and wildlife were so beautifully and sympathetically written that I didn't really notice that as I was reading. Thoroughly enjoyable from start to finish.

title: A most enjoyable read
text_review: I was recommended this book and I have found it hard to put down. It seems unimaginable for a little girl to be abandoned by her parents and siblings and she managed to stay alive with grit and determination. Her friend Tate taught her to read and with her painting skills she wrote and drew objects she loved from the Marsh. An exceptional plot and story.

title: More about wetlands of America
text_review: I chose this book for a book club read. I have yet to find out how others enjoyed and/or appreciated it.I did enjoy it and learnt more about the wetlands of America, the wildlife and the inhabitants. The storylinewas good too.

title: Brilliant book
text_review: I loved this book so much I've bought it for 4 friends so far. They all love it. Bring on the film but be very careful about who is cast in the leading role. Does the little lad in Lion have a kid sister living in the deep south of the States?

title: A beautiful story
text_review: Just finished this novel and it‚Äôs left me quite speechless. I just loved this book. The writing is fantastic with amazing vivid descriptions of the nature and beauty of the Marsh. ReallyEnjoyed how the plot goes back and forth in time between the murder in 1969 and also looking back on Kya‚Äôs life from the early ‚Äò50‚Äôs up until that point. I completely fell in love with the character and was left quite emotional at the end of it. A must read.

title: Poignant story of prejudice and isolation, courage and spirit
text_review: Found it a little slow to start but the development of the character into the young woman meant I strongly identified with her. The author beautifully recreated the landscape of the marsh in my mind and her articulation of the characters made them real and believable. I physically felt the pain of abandonment and the shame of being an outcast. Beautiful book

title: It draws you in then you're hooked
text_review: I would never have chosen this book but a friend recommended it. I read the Amazon sample and was hooked. It kept me guessing about what would happen next and is a great story. Lovely descriptions of the area that the book is set in and the characters were  well formed too. Very good

title: Loved it
