text_review: Not quite 5 stars as took a while for me to get into the book and end felt a bit rushed with lots of loose ends tidied up. Beautifully - and cleverly - written with a bit of a twist at the end. I actually had years in my eyes at one point

title: Escapism
text_review: After reading the reviews I was unsure what to expect. But I with so many recommendations I couldn‚Äôt resist. I was not disappointed. I couldn‚Äôt put my kindle down! A story of a young abandoned girl, who throughout her life found love and let her guard down, but was hurt over and over again. Left to fend for herself from a young age, right into adulthood shows her strength to survive physically and mentally. The descriptions of her marsh, shack and all the nature around her fills your mind of shapes, colours and images of being there with Kya. A beautiful read.

title: A refreshing change
text_review: When I first started the book I was about to put it down. Chapter 3 was the turning point and then I read the whole book till 2am. The characters are well developed and you really get an emotional bond with kya. It is the only book that has not gone down the 'normal tour's and provides shocking revelations. Each character you can warm despite their actions Delia provides the emotional backdrop for you to understand their behaviours. I can't wait to read any future novels.

title: A memorable read.
text_review: Loved this book from beginning to end. Those  in my bookclub all agreed it is beautifully written, although some said it was a bit unrealistic in parts. I am very happy with the storyline and found all the content pleasing. A memorable read.

title: Brilliant
text_review: Loved this book and thoroughly enjoyed every single word x have recommended this to family and friends x the book made me feel like I was on the marshes with Kya x amazing how strong it made her but very vulnerable at the same time x LOVELY READING xxx üòä

title: Nature led murder mystery
text_review: Beautifully written nature led coming of age story which explores racism, extreme poverty and an inspiring human spirit. It transported me to another world and threw in a murder mystery for good measure. Good choice for a reading group.

title: The most beautiful gripping story of survival.
text_review: Hard to put down, the story of the Marsh Girl, abandoned at 7 years  old,  shunned by society, apart from one boy who loves her and one who lusts for her.How as a beautiful naturalist she finds a place only to be tried for murder.

title: Love the title
text_review: The story is about a girl who has to struggle with domestic violence, abandonment, prejudice, loneliness in a poor fishing town  in North Carolina. I couldn't put in he book down once I started. I recommend this book I think it will become a classic.

title: Beautiful
text_review: I lost myself in this book. It will stay with me forever I think. Kya, Jumpin, Tate, Mabel all such beautifully written characters. It was warming yet so lonely at times. I felt like I had been to the setting the descriptions were so well written.

title: Such a moving story
text_review: I read this book from cover to cover in less than a day. I genuinely couldn‚Äôt bear to put it down. It‚Äôs such a well written tale and the story itself really drew me in. I found myself weeping for Kya at certain points. Her story broke my heart a little so I loved the quiet way some of the other characters kept her going. I‚Äôd recommend this book to anyone really and I‚Äôm pretty sure they‚Äôd enjoy it too.

title: What a triumph!
text_review: This is one of the best books I have ever read.  It identifies a time when cruelty and irrational judgments cause massive vulnerability.  The story is told dispassionately, but with a skill which sweeps through the mind creating clear images. Survival is not dependent on others.  Where justice and fairness have no relevance the human being can triumph.

title: Great story, beautifully and poetically written
text_review: Best book I‚Äôve read for a long time. I was engrossed and lived the story.  The authors descriptions are so vivid and poet I felt like I was there with the protagonist. Interesting, intriguing story. Highly recommend if you want a good story and something a little different

title: Engaging story beautifully set in unfamiliar nature
text_review: The story of Kya, the Marsh Girl, evokes the life of the Carolina marshes and lagoons,  unfamiliar to me, and to most readers, sings with the raw beauty of the setting. A tale lovingly told, and full of exquisitely researched detail.

title: Read this book!
text_review: Beautifully written book, so descriptive it encouraged me to find out more about the ‚Äòswamp people‚Äô. What I really appreciated was the detail at the end. This is so rare, I get so annoyed when you invest in characters and the book just ends suddenly. I really hope they make a movie from this...

title: Brilliant.
text_review: Could not put this down. Totally captured by the characters from the get go.  In fact looking forward to reading it again.  A friend recommended this book as it was her book club‚Äôs latest read and it wad thoroughly enjoyed by all.

title: Thoughtfully written from personal pain
text_review: What a delightful book, excellent, written so thoughtfully from experienced pain, it resonated with me. Inspiring and enthusing... as were Cry of the Kalahari ('80s) and Survivor's Song ('90s) which I still hold precious. Thank you

title: Great story
text_review: I thoroughly enjoyed this book. It was very well written, with vivid descriptions of the setting taking the reader to the place. The story evoked many emotions and kept me guessing until the end. I admired the main character and empathised with her.

title: Outstanding
text_review: Utterly stunning. Moving, exciting, beautifully written. A story that managed to involve and engage throughout, to take you into the most glorious natural world and educate you whilst giving you characters who will always be remembered and also provide crime thriller suspense. Thoroughly recommended.

title: Beautifully written
text_review: This book will take you on an emotional journey. Delia Owen makes you fall in love with the main character - Kya. I beamed with pride at her highs and cried at her lows. The story has everything, thriller and romance are entwined in a becoming of age adventure. Delia Owens is a fantastic writer who made me feel I was there amidst the marsh. I‚Äôve suggested to all my friends this is a must read!

title: Detailed descriptions of Nature to enjoy.
text_review: I enjoyed the descriptions of the swamp wildlife and the story was fine though you knew early on from what the protagonist said that she had done it. Part of me felt the novel was a vehicle for The author to show off her knowledge.

title: An atmospheric page turner
text_review: Once you have suspended any disbelief that a six year old can bring herself up, this is a compelling story.  The descriptions of the landscape are full, and Kya is a worthy heroine.  Some characters lacked dimension, but the story managed without it.  I'm quite sad to have finished reading.

title: Wonderfully bittersweet
text_review: I loved this book. The richness of the descriptions allowed me to feel I was on the marshes with Kya. There were beautiful moments and completely heart rending the next. Although the ending seemed rushed at first, it was right to end the story as the author did. Would definitely recommend.

title: Outstanding
text_review: If you only read one book this year, make Where the Crawdads Sing your first choice. An exceptional story that is simply unforgettable. Very much deserving of 5*++++

title: Beautifully written
text_review: A beAutifully written, gripping story which I thoroughly enjoyed reading. So much thought has gone into the character profiles and the descriptions of the surroundings are in such great detail you can really take yourself there.I liked how the story touched on so many different important and compelling topics in such a natural way. Highly recommend and hope to see more from the author.

title: Beautiful
text_review: Beautifully written book. My heart went out to the little girl left to fend for herself and disliked by the town for living in the Marsh. Kya is extremely intelligent and I just wanted to hug and protect her from the dangers of the world.I could not put this book down and now that I finished it I feel like I lost a friend. I smiled, I cried, I held my breath. I didnt want it to finish.

title: Different
text_review: I read this book on recommendation from a friend and was initially sceptical as to whether it was the sort of book I'd enjoy.  Thought if was probably a 'rags to riches' type of book, but I was very surprised and thoroughly enjoyed it.

title: Riveting!!
text_review: One of those "don't speak to me I'm reading" books! Absolutely wonderful, beautifully written, atmospheric, lyrical ...all these things combined with a mystery, a murder, and deep deep secrets. I read it without a break. Do so!

title: Be prepared to fall in love
text_review: The solitude of Kya and her world draws you in as gently and surely as a lure on a line. As her struggle to survive seems to be easing, love entangles her and the outside world drags her into its unwelcome clutches.A book which stealthily captures your heart so thoroughly that you mourn its passing with the final word.

title: Brilliant story telling
text_review: Wonderfully writing with great attention to detail. It captures the extraordinary life of the marshes and we get to experience it in all its glory . Kya is a compelling character with a tragic  and lonely life, always an outsider. The story is engaging and the key characters  are well drawn. The suspense makes it difficult to put down and the twists and turns as the story hurtles to its denouement are well worth the ride

title: Ok if you want something easy to read.
text_review: This book was...ok. It‚Äôs hugely over-hyped. It started out well but I don‚Äôt think the side characters were well developed. The only one I felt I got to know aside from Kya was Jumpin‚Äô. Certain parts felt rushed and other parts were overly explained. There was far too much descriptive text about the marsh throughout the book. I ended up skim reading those bits.I didn‚Äôt finish the book caring much about any of the characters and that says a lot.

title: One of my best reads this year
text_review: A beautifully written and unusual story which takes you through the lifetime of a neglected child who grows up surrounded by nature and some special people. With mystery thrown in for good measure. Wonderful, just wonderful. Touching, exciting, suspenseful interesting and powerful. Highly recommended.

title: It is a lovely book
text_review: I would recommed this book to anyone. It‚Äôs not that they ought to read it it any one can say that. This book educationally is probably not the best in the world. But for feel good it is a book worth more than I have ever read.

title: Great Read
text_review: This has to be about the best book I have read this year. Really held my attention from the first page. Only thing I was unsure of was what race the main character for part of the book, this didn't spoil the story line though.

title: Totally Absorbing
text_review: This is so well written, rich characters, observant, tender descriptions of nature and a mirror on society's prejudices. My heart wept for a poor child so hurt and damaged by people, yet saved by the creatures she lived amongst. I couldn't put it down. Brilliant.

title: Beautiful book. A must read.
text_review: This book is a five stars plus. The prose is set at a pace that draws you in slowly at first but then it gets inside your brain and settles in your heart. A book I will never forget. Magical, sad, haunting but uplifting too.

title: Mixed feelings
text_review: Delia Owens writes the most visual , lyrical descriptions of marsh land.  And for those descriptions of that wilderness and the wildlife, this book is a delight.  But (and apologies), Kya is a difficult character to cope with...

title: Enthralling!
text_review: This book was chosen by the book club I belong to as the January book. As I got into the story I found I couldn‚Äôt put it down. Enthralling!!  The main character Kya lives a difficult life to say the least and to see her move forward and the decisions she makes is awesome. Lovely twist at the end!!

title: Beautifully descriptive writing
text_review: A good story in a very unusual setting. It is very atmospheric and you really feel for the lonely young child looking longingly down the path. And cheer her rise through the adversities even if there is a hint of fairy story about it! Well worth reading.

title: An Enchanting Tale of Nature & Humanity drawn by Love
text_review: It‚Äôs a long time since I read a book that had me enthralled for different reasons. Starting slowly with breathtaking descriptions of a landscape I have never seen in a language I have never heard, I was drawn into a story of love & abandonment & resolution and right at the end, the unexpected turn. A masterpiece of writing & storytelling. Loved it!

title: Amazing - beautiful
text_review: Where the Crawdads Sing tells the story of the life of Kya, only a toddler when she is abandoned by her mother due to her violent father and her siblings soon abandon her too. Left to fend for herself on the marshlands, Kya learns to survive.The book features beautiful descriptions of the marshlands that Kya calls home and the wild life that live there too. I cried three times reading this book and found myself rooting for Kya so strongly that I sobbed when I finished the book. A story that teaches us to be kind to everyone, even those who are different from us and to never underestimate the underdog.

title: Not so good
text_review: After reading this book I feel like I have wasted my time. The beginning has so much unnecessary detail. And then end of the book where there should be more detail, was instead rushed. Disappointing read, no true climax. I feel empty inside.

title: A moving story.
text_review: Beautifully written, captivating the plight of a young girl on the outskirts of society with no real family to support or society. It avoids being sentimental and about overcoming disadvantages by a strong human strength.

title: beautifully written
text_review: had been recommended by my daughter.  it is different. stunning descriptions of wildlife and countryside.  very moving and beautifully written. underneath it all there is a murder mystery.  loved this book. absolutely recommend this book

title: A book to get lost in
text_review: I loved this book a young girl left alone in the marshes of North Carolina I have been there and it took me back full of mystery love wild life I was  told  about this book by a friend .lent it to my sister who had not been reading for a while but this book kicked started her love of reading again. Do give it a try you won‚Äôt regret it .

title: Hauntingly Beautiful and Gripping Story
text_review: The book would‚Äôve been fine as a coming-of-age story, a nature book or a crime mystery. Weaving the three together so well is a marvellous achievement. It‚Äôs no surprise it‚Äôs been so highly rated!

title: A perfect story of love and resilience.
text_review: This is a tale of triumph in adversity. The author describes such beautiful landscapes and the discovery of true love against all the odds. I took this book away as a holiday read to escape into my own imagination. I truly didn't want this book to end.

title: Breathtaking
text_review: At first I wasn‚Äôt sure why this booked worked. But gradually I was hooked. I read it in the bath, propped up at the breakfast table and foregoing Netflix during the evening read until the end. Needless to say I loved it.

title: Totally engrossing
text_review: This is a beautiful, poignant story depicting the life of a near friendless girl abandoned by family and spurned by local townspeople, yet managing to build a life living amongst nature to eventually develop and benefit from an outstanding talent. The small gestures of kindness from a small number of people help her to experience moments of love and acceptance. Accused of a terrible crime a breath holding  courtroom drama follows, and the story culminates in a poignant ending with a surprising twist. Highly recommend this book.

title: A beautifully crafted novel
text_review: A young girl finds herself living, virtually alone, in the marshlands of North Carolina.  The story develops a captivating and original plot with a well balanced pace.  Don‚Äôt read it too fast, enjoy the ambience and the love.

title: Too much swamp, not enough story
text_review: Beautiful writing, but not enough to keep me reading I'm afraid. Everyone else I know loved it though!

title: A gentle beauty!
text_review: A beautiful tale. Heartbreak for an abandoned child, who‚Äôs courage will astound you. A joy and pride for every day that she survived. A deep need to show her love and kindness to teach her not all are cruel and heartless.

title: The MarshGirl
text_review: Tremendously descriptive and builds a wonderful picture of a lost little girl, Kya, struggling as a young desolate child on a lonely marsh with nature her only real companion. It has a twist which makes for suspense all the way to the end!

title: An instant classic.
text_review: I'm pretty sure that everything that could be said about this book has already been laid out, so I'll keep it brief.This is a novel that will go down as one of the Great American classics - it will be remembered for hundreds of years, and well-deservedly so.The prose is out of this world. The setting and the characters, beautiful beyond words. The ending, chilling and heartbreaking.One of the top 5 most memorable books that I have ever read. Thank you, Mrs. Owens. I will never forget this one.

title: This book is Brilliant
text_review: This book was a wonderful read.  Unusual and thought provoking.  The descriptive passages transported the reader to the marshlands of Carolina and the prose flowed throughout.  The book was recommended by a friend and we have discussed it.  When we get back to Book Club it will be an excellent contribution.

title: What a beautiful book
text_review: I loved this book. The lyrical style of writing, the fascinating story, which kept me gripped. Thank goodness for the lockdown, which gave me time to just just read and dive into this wonderful story, a story that will stay with me.

title: Wow brilliant
text_review: Oh I just loved this book right from the first few pages. It was a beautifully told story, superb characters and the description of the marsh just perfect. I really was transported to the place.So sad to finish the book, loved every part of it.

title: Enthralling
text_review: I cannot wait for the film of this book about a girl labelled and tarnished by the local community for being abandoned as a child. Who triumphed over adversity and achieved my Christmas in the quietest way. I hope the film does Kya justice

title: A must read
text_review: Where the crawdads sing is a real page turner.i couldn‚Äôt put the book down.i couldn‚Äôt guess who had killed chase,as plot kept twisting and turning right up until the end.A wonderful,gripping read.And it‚Äôs her first novel.what an achievement.

title: A truly wonderful read...
text_review: ... with secrets and twists, heartbreaking and uplifting moments throughout. You feel so strongly and so protectively of Kya and the journey she makes to becoming a woman. A lovely read and a beautiful ending. Sadness that the pages ended.

title: One of the best book I have ever read
text_review: Such a captivating story from the start. The author pulls you in with her detail and rich description of the landscape. Drawing into a world very different from my own. While it is haunting in places the two time frames run along side each other beautifully, coming together to an exciting conclusion. I could not put it down  and even though I  read it a few weeks ago, I almost want to read it again. This is very different to anything I normally read, but I'm so glad I did. Anyone who decides to read this is in for a treat.

title: What a beautiful sad story
text_review: Honestly this is one of the best books that I have ever read. Its a story of Kya who is abandoned in the marshes in the late 60s. Its a love story, its a sad story, its a court room drama too. All the 5 star reviews are right. Highly recommend as the book of the year!

title: Truly beautiful
text_review: As an ecologist myself, I found the description of the marsh and the wildlife beautiful.  The writing is amazing and descriptive and the characters felt so real. I was sad to finish this book, I wanted it to go on forever.

title: Truly amazing
text_review: When I started reading this book I wasn‚Äôt sure I wanted to carry on, but I persisted and a few chapters in I could not put it down. This book reached so many different emotions I felt like I was inside the book watching it all play out. I could visualise the characters, the scenery and hear their voices. I am so glad I read this book and I will have to reread it again some day.

title: Wow what a lovely book.
text_review: This was our book club choice and we all loved it - which is a first !!Fabulous descriptions of the surroundings of the book - you almost felt as though you were there.Made us all cry in a good way .One of our best ever books.highly recommend.

title: My very best read in a long time
text_review: A wonderful book - so good have bought two copies to give to friends.  It‚Äôs a brilliant insight about the flora & fauna of North Carolina. I could almost hear the crows. Also about a young girls struggle to survive in unthinkable circumstances.

title: Clearly already a classic
text_review: What an amazing, powerful, humbling story. Thank you.There‚Äôs been mockingbirds, hobbits, wrestlers, moles, Chinese granddaughters and now crawdads that have shaped my life and thinking.  Again, thank you.

title: Fabulous story of isolation and triumph
text_review: This is a great book! The story of how a child is left alone in the marsh, to fend for herself, and how she grows up, befriended by other outcasts and her soul mate. Is she also a murderer? I won't spoil it for you.

title: A well written wonderful story
text_review: I loved the way the setting was ‚Äòpainted‚Äô By Delia Owens. I could see it vividly in my mind. The heroine‚Äôs character was well developed from childhood through to old age and the other characters complimented the story line.I loved the twist at the end too, like a little wink to the reader.

title: Brilliant
text_review: This is one of the most beautifully written books I have read for some time. The setting and main characters are described wonderfully allowing attachment to them carry the reader gently to the surprising end. I believe this is going to be made into a film. I hope the filmmakers do it the justice it so deserves

title: Hauntingly beautiful
text_review: This was one of the most beautiful stories and took me right into the marshes go N Carolina with its birds and wildlife. Stunning. It moved me to tears.

title: Good story and poetic descriptions
text_review: I am half way through this wonderful novel and thoroughly enjoying the story and descriptions of the way of life and the marshlands and wild life. As I was due to visit the southern USA, including South Carolina,  last April it makes me sad of what I‚Äôve missed.

title: Pleased I gave this a second go
text_review: I very nearly passed this by - initially, I felt the prose overworked and slow, so left it. I was persuaded by seeing it in so many top summer reads to give it another go, and it unfolded into a beauty: the characters and plot were drawn perfectly. Just one niggle with the ending - was there a need to tie it together quite so securely? It seems to be the editorial preference at the moment.

title: I couldn‚Äôt put this book down once I picked it up!
text_review: Got this book to get me through quarantine and I already finish the book with in just a couple days,  I couldn‚Äôt put it down. Amazing descriptions of the wetlands, Marsh, and the seaside of North Carolina. You relate to the main character and from the first few pages I was completely invested. Couldn‚Äôt recommend this book enough especially for women!

title: Just brilliant
text_review: Wasn't sure if this was for me to start with, then whoosh, off I went on a wonderful journey through a truly beautiful and unique story.  Nothing more I can say that hasn't already been said, one of those books you rarely find. Loved it.

title: Louisiana wildlife thriller
text_review: Beautiful descriptive writing on flora and fauna of the North Louisiana marshes, and the lives of the ‚Äòmarsh trash ‚Äò who exist mostly in poverty there.  I fear the tale of a six year old abandoned by her family, her survival and learning to read, feed herself and cope with the isolation barely believable.However an interesting read.

title: What a beautiful book
text_review: A beautiful book, haunting, uplifting and a compelling read. Very unusual story however it hooks you and the descriptions and backdrop are so well written you feel immersed in the setting bring the characters to life.

title: It‚Äôs unputdownable
text_review: That fact that this first novel by Delia Owens has already sold over 5 mill copies worldwide, tells you something. The book is unique, painfully beautiful at times, it‚Äôs a murder mystery yes, but it‚Äôs also about survival. I shall be reading it again and again

title: Well Written But Slow.
text_review: I purchased this on a friend's recommendation who said it was the best book he had read this year. I cannot agree but it was different, but I guessed the end well before I reached it and it was somewhat overlong.

title: Absolutely amazing book
text_review: Omg. Absolutely loved loved loved this book. I couldn't put it down. Such amazing, beautiful writing and the story was so beautiful, trajic and inspiring at the same time. It's one of the best books I've ever read. Highly recommend.

title: Now in my top 5 favourites!
text_review: An ecolgist, so the accuracy with the ecological writing was a massive plus. I don't normally read fiction, but this was recommended to me and thank goodness it was! What a captivating, addictive, enjoyable read! This book and Kya has become ingrained within me and will stay with me. What a gift and talent Delia has to be able to imprint her work of art into someone's mind forevermore!

title: Pulled along like a tide
text_review: From a slow start, the story zig zags from one time-line to another until eventually, they begin to close and time is squeezed. The story wound around itself like a sea-shell.Beautiful, lyrical and clever.

title: WHAT A FANTASTIC READ.
text_review: AMAZING. Incredible. When I stopped reading, I would end up thinking about the marsh and wanting to go back and be in that world, which I haven't felt for a book since I was a child. A fantastic job was done in terms of creating a strong sense of environment. It was great.

title: Best read ever
text_review: Where the Crawdads Sing is one of the best books I have ever read. It had a mixture of all of the elements that make up the remarkable telling of a brilliant tale. I recommend it without hesitation to anyone looking for a gripping , informative and totally engaging read.

title: A real page turner
text_review: I highly recommend this book.  So cleverly written, you can almost smell the sea and hear the birds.  It‚Äôs a sad story with lots of twists and turns.  A tale of prejudice but also kindness and love.  Brilliant!

title: Loved it
text_review: Loved it! I found it hard to get into at first, the accented speech was a bit tricky for me to follow. I found myself completely drawn in and the ending caused good debate at my book club. I really liked the ending.

title: Brilliant!,,
text_review: Whew - what an amazing story and so well written.I never wanted to put it down as the story wove around amazing prose and made the story so real. Amazing knowledge of the wildlife was beautifully entwined with such interesting characters.

title: A beautiful imagining.
text_review: The setting is an imaginative account of the psychology of repeated abandonment and the healing power of some friendships - also , even primarily, by the nature of the marshland in which the child lives. Moving and memorable.

title: Wow
text_review: Wow just wow... Never has a book had me so enthralled that I could actually feel the waters of Kya's existence, could listen to bird song with  different ears, could almost feel her loneliness... This has to be the best book I have read and will stay with me always

title: Outstanding!
text_review: An amazing first novel telling an unusual story of love,  trust, sorrow, fear, prejudice and kindness within a setting of nature with a  beauty unseen by many. Delia Owens tells a moving story encompassing the many varied  facets of human nature and sometimes their parallels in the natural world.

title: Breathtaking
text_review: Not since To KillA Mockingbird, have I lived and died for a book. This is uplifting, breathtaking in its scope, majestic in its ability to capture Kaya's life, and with an adorable twist, two actually, to boot. Loved this book.

title: Excellent
text_review: It took me a bit to get into this book, as I found the language quite difficult.  However, I persisted, and I am so glad I did. Beautifully written and worked. A gentle book of prejudice and first love. Thoroughly enjoyed it.

title: Wonderful beautifully written book
text_review: I wasn't sure I would like this book as it isn't the sort of book I usually read. However, it was so beautifully written I couldn't put it down. I am sure if I go to the area I will instantly know the people and the scenery. It also has themes of prejudice and not looking under the surface of how people present themselves. Who are the true"Christians" and who just like to present themselves as such - absorbing

title: Well written and with a gentle but strong story
text_review: What a lovely story. It seemed to flow so effortlessly that you become lost in the story and forget the world around you. It reminded me, in a very good way, of To Kill a Mockingbird. If you liked that book, I am sure you will like this one.I am sorry it is finished and hope the author continues to write.

title: Loved this book
text_review: Exquisite  words, beautifully  written. Makes me want to visit the area to see with my own eyes  the things that Kya saw.

title: Buy it, read it and love it.
text_review: This is one of those books when you've finished, is like the passing of someone close. You need to pause and grief but also rejoiced in having know them, been part of them. Then you will spend days pining and moping before you move on.I was captivated by Kya. Her treatment by those around her resonates still today, as we see those who are different with fear and suspicious. Love still works it hopeful magic.If you love stories set in the mystery that is North Carolina, you can't go wrong with Where The Crawdads Sing

title: Let you imagination take you to Kya and her Marsh
text_review: I would not normally have picked this up but it was a Claire Mackintosh book of month so I decided to give it a go and I am so thankful that I did. Never before has a book moved me to tears like this one did. I have never been very good at imagining the characters or places in the books I read I just want to know what happens and who did it. But with this I was totally swept away to the Marsh and to Kya and her gulls the images were so clear in my mind. It is beautifully written and is a story of courage, love and loss. A beautiful book and a brilliant story.

title: Social isolation in the swamps of Louisiana
text_review: Started this book a few times and wasnt particularly taken by it. This time persevered and really enjoyed it. Descriptions of the swamps amazing enveloping you in sights and sounds. Story brilliantly explains the feelings of isolation of those who are different.

title: Great story
text_review: Excellent who dunnit where the background is so well described by the author that it is another character in the tale. Pity that the courtroom scenes are so lacking in our heroine's thoughts and feelings.

title: Good read...disappointing ending
text_review: Really enjoyed this book...great writing especially the natural history part but the ending let it down. There wasn't a twist or surprise at all as reviewed by the publisher...The ending just faded away ...nothing about how the victim in the story came to his demise...shame.

title: Fantastic
text_review: After finishing this book I now have readers block! No book lives up to this! One of the best books I have read in a very long time, it took me a few hours to read it as I could not put it down! Would definitely recommend

title: A must read
text_review: This is my new favourite book. It‚Äôs such a great read. I couldn‚Äôt wait to pick it up every evening and get lost in it‚Äôs pages again. I have passed it around my family and they love it too. I expect it will get made into a film (which won‚Äôt be as good as the book).

title: Intrigue like no other!
text_review: This book drew me in to Kya's young life, initially, like no other. Wonderfully written, the imagery brought to life at every page turn. Her innocent and yet essential relationships to help her through to adulthood and beyond were all-inspiring.  The marsh, the beach, and inhabitants therein are all magical.  Be warned... you will not put it down!

title: An enjoyable read
text_review: A very enjoyable read.I had been to the Outer Banks of North Carolina,where this book is set, so was captivated by the descriptions of the area and touched by the life that Kya was forced to endure when left alone at a young age.The murder and ensuing trial was an added bonus.

title: Beautiful evocative rich, heart wrenching and heart warming
text_review: When an author describes a place so well that you feel you know it like the back of your hand.  Brilliantly drawn complex characters who you care about from the very first encounter with them. Utterly absorbing, I dwelt within this book and was sorry finish it! Such a well told story with a very satisfying ending.

title: Nice prose.
text_review: Nicely written but you must be willing to suspend your disbelief in order to enjoy it, which I suppose is true of many works of fiction, as it is a little far fetched. Reminded me of Uncle Tom‚Äôs Cabin!

title: I loved it!
text_review: This is a really brilliant read inspiring empathy with the core characters and huge involvement with Kya. It explores the working of the USA's Deep South and the white/coloured issues.I loved it!

title: Nature and the wild.
text_review: Mostly liked this book. The setting and descriptions of wild life were fabulous. The plot was good. I would like to have believed a child could grow up alone in the marshes but was not convinced and that was the main flaw in the novel, and the reason I gave three stars.Anyone interested in birds and nature would love this book.

title: Far fetched story
text_review: Most far fetched story. How would a totally illiterate 7year old end up writing books. Also how could she go unnoticed for all those years, it just wound me up so was very pleased when the book ended!

title: To enjoy, one has to suspend belief at the likely reality of the plot!
text_review: Thought this might be a ‚Äògirly‚Äô book but enjoyed the read immensely. One really has to suspend belief at the plausibility if the plot, with too many implausible occurrences but, hey, in these strange times why not?

title: Beautiful - made me cry!
text_review: I found this book slightly boring at first - the same stuff was happening over and over again (Kya just doing random stuff around the marsh) - every time the plot was going somewhere it stopped.But, towards the end of the book, the pace becomes a lot quicker. I became very invested in it. I even cried at the end, and only two books have made me do this, the other one being Wild - Cheryl Strayed. For this reason, I will love and remember this book forever.I lent it to my mum and she cried too.

title: Best book for ages
text_review: Unusual story set in mid states USA. Sad childhood of a little girl who we follow to becoming a woman. Without care she has to survive alone. Very moving- sure will make a good film. Highly recommend

title: Loved it!
text_review: I read the 'bad' reviews with astonishment. I loved this book. A fascinating premise and central character. The descriptions of the swamp and the wildlife were great to set the backdrop to the plot.

title: Immersive
text_review: A beautifully written book, expertise on the marshes mixed with expertise on the heart of a person who is different.  People pass shell, grass and flora, looking but not seeing. And they do the same with Kya.  How much we miss when we make our minds up on advance of knowledge.

title: Really beautifully written
text_review: Couldn‚Äôt put this book down - a real page turner. Beautifully written - I was able to picture every character and aspect - made me laugh and cry and held my attention right to the end. One of the best books I‚Äôve read. Would love to see it made into a film. Would thoroughly recommend.

title: Couldn't put down
text_review: This is a story of love loss and loneliness-couldn't put it down.You instantly fall in love with kya the lead character as you follow her through her tragic life praying for that speck of happiness she deserves.The story is brilliantly written jumping back and forth through the years and keeps you guessing until the end.

title: Descriptive story
text_review: I enjoyed the descriptive part of the story with the characters coming alive, especially the trial but thought the ending was unexpected.  I've lent it to several friends and they have enjoyed it.

title: Being different
text_review: Incredible story- not giving anything away but the ending tied up the mystery.  Loved the character Kya and how people reacted to and against her.  The speech that Tom Milton makes tells of how her life could have been so different if society could have helped her but look at what she had become,virtually, by herself.

title: Brilliant, brilliant, brilliant
text_review: Has everything. Nature, shades of the Snow Goose, authentic romance, drama, unpredictable, beautiful writing. Against the background of what is going on in Trumpland has a powerful message without any preachiness, if that's a word! I'm a 77 year old grandfather and it was recommended by my daughter. We both loved it. Don't hesitate. Buy it.

title: The Marsh Girl
text_review: This was so different from any books I have ever read.  My heart went out to Kya who was a survivor.  Could not put this book down and felt disappointed as well as numb that I had come to the end of The Marsh Girl.

title: I loved it!
text_review: I know some of the events are a bit unrealistic as other reviewers have mentioned and sometimes it feels too rushed but the plot is absolutely touching and the descriptions of nature wonderful. I would recommend. It is a great read.

title: A must to read
text_review: A lovely story but don‚Äôt read about it before you read the book or you will spoil the excitementWell written and keeps you wanting to continue readingSo descriptive you could be there

title: Awesome
text_review: A story of an abandoned child,raising herself in  the worst kind of poverty and striving to be accepted, all the while knowing she never would be. I loved this book, the descriptions of the marsh existence are heartbreakingly realistic, and I read it in two sittings.

title: Couldn't put it down
text_review: I got totally swept up in this story and the character of Kya. Hard to believe this is Delia's first novel! The writing felt so competent i was sure she must have written loads of books. It would definitely make a great movie.

title: My favourite book!
text_review: This is the best book I have ever read. I could NOT put it down and at the same time I didn‚Äôt want it to end. I personally felt the story line was unpredictable and I enjoyed the suspense. It took a short while to really get into it but once I was a few chapters in, I could not put it down. I‚Äôm looking forward to the release of the movie!

title: Beautifully written, enchanting and a very surprising end!
text_review: I haven't read a book properly for over a year, this was an amazing and enchanting story. I couldn't put it down. Beautiful descriptions of the Marshes and birdlife. Very surprising final chapter.

title: An exceptionall book
text_review: I loved this book from the first few pages. The rich language and the unique character of Kya  totally  gripped me.  The story was not sentimental in any way but I had total empathy for the main character and the struggles she had borne so bravely . I enjoyed this book so much  . I was amazed that this was the author's first novel. A wonderful read .

title: Beautiful
text_review: The descriptive writing, although at first I found it irritating, was truly key to creating such incredibly vivid images. It drew me in, hook, line and sinker and I struggled to put the book down. Truly beautiful story.

title: Is isolation a good thing?
text_review: I loved this book. It‚Äôs well written and the descriptions of the marsh are brilliant. I really got a feeling of what it‚Äôs like there. I‚Äôm not sure if the characters are entirely believable but I didn‚Äôt notice, as I was so involved.

title: Book club
text_review: I personally loved this book! For book club we are meant to read set chapters every week and discuss but I loved this book so much and I couldn‚Äôt put it down so I finished in 2 weeks instead of 4. I don‚Äôt understand the bad reviews, I appreciate everyone has their own opinions but if you‚Äôre considering reading this book then just do it! Don‚Äôt let our reviews influence you.

title: ‚ÄúAll you need is Love‚Äù
text_review: One of the best books I have ever read and I get through a lot of books, it made me start thinking about Nature and the way we live, a wonderfully crafted debut, storytelling at its best, I can‚Äôt wait to see what Hollywood will do with this, if it‚Äôs handled carefully we could have an absolute gem of a film. I can‚Äôt recommend this book highly enough.

title: Rarely you  find such a book.
text_review: It is rare to find such an interesting book. I was completely engrossed in the fascinating story of the marshes. I loved Kya and how different she was. What a strange and hard life she had. I'm glad it had a happy ending but very sad in its own way.

title: Lovely story....
text_review: The reviews were surprisingly mixed. I enjoyed it. Loved reading through her difficult child hood and great characters.  A nice book to ease me back into reading. If you enjoy books like the help, you will love it.

title: Amazing and extraordinary insight into loneliness and it's resulting anguish yet beautiful rewards
text_review: This book is can amazing insight into loneliness. It's horrendous outcomes yet it's amazing opportunity to show how human loneliness and it's consequences can be overcome and won no matter what!  The reader is totally  absorbed by this heart wrenching, yet warm story. The author cleverly  cocoons you in the world of character's loneliness and you are wrapped up inside this story. Turning page after page eagerly to unfold what will happen next and how human compassion can unfold.  Absolutely brilliant.

title: I could hear the gulls and the grass in the wind
text_review: The plot is predictable, the events unrealistic, the heroine's survival and capabilities unbelievable and the end unsurprising, but the journey to get there is nevertheless an enjoyable read.

title: Refreshingly different page turner
text_review: Best book Ive read this year.  Poignant, descriptiveand heart wrenching. you will wonder how she survived all alone but this book has a twist that has you guessing until the last page.

title: Beautifully written
text_review: Absolutely beautiful book, I felt it to the very last and take my hat off to Delia Owens for the sensitivity in which it was written. This is not a book for the people without a poetic soul.

title: easy reading
text_review: I loved this book. It is beautifully written with lovely descriptions of the environment in the marshlandThe story whips along although I couldn't put it down, I didn't want it to end.

title: Recommended
text_review: Beautifully written. A real treasure of a story that had me enthralled from the start. Left me feeling like I know the marshland and have met a TRUELY remarkable character. Absolutely loved it.

title: A FANTASTIC READ
text_review: Beautifully written, my heart is still pounding! Kya had me with her every step of the way. I could picture her shack!! the marsh, hear the bird calls almost smell the sea. I have never reviewed a book before but I felt I had to with this piece of magic. I simply loved this book, a must read for anyone who even enjoys nature , love or a  mystery. Heartbroken I have to wait for her next book. Not too long I hope.

title: Beautiful and Heart Breaking
text_review: This book absolutely captivated me. The writing was lyrical and beautiful. The description of the setting was glorious. I adored the characters and in places it broke my heart. I would highly recommend this book.

title: Simply stunning read!
text_review: The writing has a simple, gentle cadence that make reading pleasurable. The words and phrasing is onomatopoeic. I loved Kya from the beginning. Such a powerful female character overcoming wave after wave of adversity. I also loved the humanity of Jumpin, Mabel, and Tate. It‚Äôs such a beautiful story and so well written. Thank you.

title: Beautiful writing
text_review: A story of isolation and abandonment mixed with experiences of coming of age, prejudice, and a murder case.The writing of this book is simply beautiful with the descriptions of Marsh life and nature so vivid, you can picture it very easily.

title: Started off well.....
text_review: I tried the sample and enjoyed that so decided to read the whole book, but was disappointed as the characters became more and more one-dimensional and cliched over time... it's a pretty unbelievable development of the main character and after a while I felt like I was reading some "tragic" love story in a  young adult novel. I found myself saying "come on....really??" more and more through the second half of the book and sadly wish I'd picked a different recommendation in the end to be honest...!

title: A big let down
text_review: I had great hopes for this book after all the rave reviews. I really struggled to keep reading it. Far too slow with language I was constantly looking up.The ending was the best but.

title: Starting a small book club
text_review: Ordered a few of these as Christmas presents to start a small book club. We are limited to what we can do during this pandemic so I thought it would be a good idea and something different. After reading all the reveiws I thought this would be a good book to start off with. I'm really excited for us to read it!3 were in good shape but unfortunetly the 4th one was a bit mucky which is disappointing but I guess that one will have to be mine.Quick delivery as always.

title: Simply Brilliant
text_review: This book is a must read, could not put it down,I loved Kya  and you can feel her loneliness, with every page. A wonderfully told story , it touched my very soul.  Loved it highly recommend reading .

title: Beautifully written.
text_review: Absolutely superb first novel. I couldn‚Äôt put it down. Beautifully written with great description of characters and setting. I was there and could not second guess the final outcome. Thoroughly recommended.

title: Fantastic Read!
text_review: I loved this boo - I couldn't put it down! I loved the tender and moving story which was told so beautifully by Delia Owens .  In fact I miss reading it ! One of the best books I have read for a very long time so thank you Delia!I am hopeful she will write another novel , and then another and another!

title: A triumph
text_review: You sometimes worry that a book has been overhyped, have no fear this novel is superb and deserves all the accolades. Beautifully written, great story including a murder mystery and courtroom drama plus a twist at the end.Enjoy

title: I have to give 5 stars, as I couldn‚Äôt put it down
text_review: After a slow start, I really got into this book. Yes, it‚Äôs unlikely and, yes, it‚Äôs predictable, but I nonetheless loved it and look forward to seeing the film I‚Äôm certain it will become.

title: A beautifully told story
text_review: The story of "the marsh girl" unfolds slowly and will intrigue all who read this beautifully told story.So eager to find out what happened next I had to force myself to read more slowly.You will change your mind 100 times as you try to guess the truth.This is a book I will read again and recommend to all my friends

title: A thought provoking good read
text_review: Struggled to get into the book at first but once I did it was a very thought provoking book. Reminded me of ‚ÄòThe God of Small Things‚Äô. Persevere and enjoy.

title: Best book I've ever read!
text_review: Each to their own but I loved it! I personally love to kill a mockingbird and feel it's a similar style of writing. I love the description and love the concept. Not read anything this good since.

title: Lose yourself in this book
text_review: Best book I‚Äôve read in a long time.Beautifully written-I absolutely lost myself in this book.I won‚Äôt give the game away but as an aside I loved the reference to Kya‚Äôs relationship with Jumpin‚Äô -made me sob almost as much as the plot line.Fantastic book!

title: Read it
text_review: My brother recommended this book to me and he did well. I loved this book, very thought provoking, when you thought you‚Äôd figured it out, yet another wee twist. Many emotions in one book.

title: A beautiful piece of writing....didn‚Äôt want it to end!
text_review: I really love this book. It pulled me into the wonderful natural world of marshes, swamps and oceans  along with all the human joys and failings and is written so beautifully. A real escape....don‚Äôt overthink it, just go with it....one I‚Äôll be reading again!

title: Ok
text_review: This is a very descriptive book in regards to the marshes, it was a good read, but not gripping enough for me

title: Just brilliant!
text_review: This is the first book (as far as I can remember) that I have rated 5 stars. It is beautifully written, the characters come alive and I felt I was in the boat and in the marshes  with that lovely girl.

title: Great book
text_review: A great to" get lost in book" I must admit I knew very little about the environment where the book is based so felt like I was experiencing a new world.Really felt emotionally for the main character

title: Compelling
text_review: I read this book over two days, staying up late to read it, I was so intrigued by the story.The descriptions of people and places are vivid.  I don‚Äôt want to say too much about the story and give anything away but it is heartbreaking and beautiful. I would definitely recommend.

title: Page turner story
text_review: Enjoyed the setting of the story. Interesting chapter structures alternating between different characters and timeline all along. Maui be the credibility of the story is a bit thin. But enjoyed three reading.

title: Read it
text_review: A brilliant book,  unlike anything I'd read before. Fabulous characters, very well written- one of those books where you know the characters personally by the time you finish reading

title: Heart breaking and beautiful
text_review: This story is wonderfully descriptive so you can see the beauty that Kya she's around her in the marsh land. Her relationship with the land and wild life more comforting than people.

title: A gripping read.
text_review: I loved this book.The writing,the descriptions of the flora and fauna,the characters. For me the currant Covid 19 lockdown and the isolation of the main character had similarities. On top of that there is a murder mystery.

title: A great read!
text_review: I really enjoyed this book.  It is well written, thought-provoking, and moving.  The descriptions of the marshlands and landscapes are a joy to read, and the main characters have depth and credibility.

title: Breathtaking!
text_review: Such a beautiful novel. I literally could not put it down. The descriptions of the marsh are breathtaking and the empathy I felt for Kya literally transported me to another world. I‚Äôm all the better for having read this little masterpiece!

title: Captivating and more addictive by the page.
text_review: This is one of the most enjoyable books I have ever read. I look forward to a time where it might be made into a movie. Wonderful writing and exceptional knowledge and description.

title: Unexpectedly brilliant.
text_review: Amazing book. Went in thinking it was a classic crime thriller and although there is that underlying theme, the book surprised me by being something else entirely. One of the best books I've read, well worth the read.

title: Murder, mystery, love story- you decide
text_review: I was a bit put off when Kay was left on her own at such a young age. However I very quickly forgot about her age as the story unfolded. This was a good read and a good ending. 10/10

title: Loved it
text_review: My husband and I just loved this book. So well written and so descriptive. Just one of these books that you didn't want to end. In this world where books are getting so alike this was an oasis in the desert. Would thoroughly recommend it.

title: One of the best books I've read this year.
text_review: Thoroughly enjoyed this book. Well written and never boring. The style of writing is excellent and it is quite clear that the author has a deep knowledge and understanding of her subject matter.

title: Enjoyed this one!
text_review: This book was a little slow to start, the first 100 pages did drag a bit for me in places-however they did set the scene for what is one of my favourite reads this year.  Great characters and a great story.  Would recommend.

title: extraordinary book
text_review: This is a beautiful written book and deals with so many life issues in a sensitive and honest way. All the characters are well drawn and the insights into a very singular life are exquisite. The level of detail on the natural world in this part of the US was mesmerising and transported me totally. A remote world brought into sharp focus in a very interesting and credible way. The writer is exceedingly skilful. I couldn't recommend it more highly.

title: I who threatened the ignorant villagers. So fitting that sheinto the marsh at the end. I was not surprised when Tate found the necklace....the marsh protected her. Thank you
text_review: I loved this story. Kya was a strong courageous person who threatened the villagers with her ability to survive and to not need their pity. She used her love for her environment and turned it into a life‚Äôs work. So fitting she would take herself off into the marsh at the end of her life. I was not surprised when Tate found the necklace....the marsh protected her in the end. Thank you for an amazing book.

title: Brilliant
text_review: Such a well written and interesting book.  Unusual in its storyline, which I loved.  Would and have highly recommended this, and if it's made into a film I shall be watching it.

title: A truly beautiful book
text_review: I can‚Äôt even begin to describe how enamoured I was with this book. You fall so in love with Kya throughout the story - I was so invested in her and her emotions. I never feel compelled to read a book twice, but as soon as I finished reading the last sentence I was ready to start it all over again - so I could be transported back into Kya‚Äôs world.

title: Simply beautiful xxx
text_review: I'm not normally one to write reviews but this book deserves it. It is beautiful written. The depth and description of the marsh land takes you beyond what you would normally find in a book. You feel every emotion Kya feels with such depth that you truly feel her sorrow. I don't want to give anything away as I feel readers should experience reading this book as I did.You will immerse yourself into this book and won't want to come out! I didn't want it to end. Enjoy xx

title: Very good read.
text_review: This book is written in a style which engages the reader and adds immensley to the story.  The author has obviously researched her topic and is able to articulate this whilst not detracting from a brilliant plot.This type of book is not what I would usually read but I am very glad I took the risk and bought it, why don't you try it too?  You won't be disappointed!

title: Beautiful, evocative, stunning
text_review: Could not fault this book. It is a rare thing that such a poignant beautiful tale comes along. I couldn‚Äôt put it down - I was hooked. Beautifully written, evocative, stunning first novel. I felt like I was there.

title: A beautiful novel
text_review: I started this book thinking it wasnt going to be my cup of tea, I normally go for really creepy thrillers!! I'm so glad I stepped outside of my comfort zone. Where the crawdads sing has opened up a whole new experience of reading for me. This book is so beautifully written and the scenery and characters almost seem to jump out of the pages so you can picture it all playing out right in front of you. I cant give the author enough praise, truly one of my favourite reads ever!!

title: Bloody Marvellous. Truly Addictive. Absolutely Beautiful!
text_review: I tend to read in bed and most mornings whilst reading this book I found myself unable to stop talking to my husband about the fascinating things I had learnt the previous night. I also feel I must emphasis the grace with which the story is told. It caused me to stop and appreciate the beauty of the written word many times. All whilst reading a superb and heartfelt crime novel. Books of this calibre don't come along too often. Read it!

title: Simply beautiful
text_review: Beautifully written, fabulous story deserves every bit of praise received. I could not put this down. Look forward to more from this author but boy this will be hard to beat!

title: This novel is held together by a convincing portrait of the development of  an abandoned child
text_review: Ing portrait of the development of an abandoned child into strong female character. The setting is the marshlands of North Carolina and narrative is driven by a murder mystery.

title: Truly enchanting
text_review: I struggled a little at first with the southern dialect and wasn‚Äôt sure that I would enjoy this book initially, but I am so glad that I persevered.The story of Kaya growing up after being abandoned by her family is heart wrenching but also warming and the characters she engages with superb!

title: There are better books out there!
text_review: I was very disappointed with this book, so many good reviews but i didn't rate it at all.Nowhere near as detailed as it could have been and very predictable story line.

title: A stunning book
text_review: I have never left a book review here but felt I had to. Where the Crawdads Sing is without doubt one of the best books I've read. Written so beautifully with perfect imagery and description, it feels that you are in the story, seeing from Kya's (the main characters) eyes. The novel is all at once, a story of true love, a drama, a murder mystery and an entrancing account of nature and the marshes. This is a wonderful book. So organic and raw, it really is a fantastic read. Highly recommended.

title: Highly recommend reading
text_review: Just finished reading this book and really interesting reading, kept me engaged and thought provoking. Covers so many areas: prejudice, discrimination, isolation, resilience, loneliness, attachment. Highly recommend reading.

title: Beautiful
text_review: The best book I have read for a long time,so vivid and heart warming,I could see the birds and feel the sea, kyas loneliness made me cry on occasions but her strength name proud. A wonderful story that will stay with me for a very long

title: Learn about the marshland of the US with this well researched and touching story
text_review: Generally, I really enjoyed this book.  Just a gripe about bus times which stretched the plot a bit.  Otherwise an insight into the treatment of white poverty in the states

title: Kya the Girl of the Marsh
text_review: This is a beautiful tale of survival. After being abandoned and left to survive by her own devices Kya reaches out to the marshland‚Äôs  wildlife for company. A beautiful, well written account of how nature became a balm for a soul damaged by human betrayal. Her achievement in life is nothing short of a miracle.

title: Incredible, original story
text_review: This is a wonderful story of determination overcoming hardship.  It is painful to read in parts, full of surprises and turns.  It is amazing and original and I really can't recommend it enough.

title: What a wonderful read
text_review: I'm feeling quite emotional having turned the last virtual page of this first novel. Owens paints a picture with her words. I can't wait to read her next piece of fiction.

title: A luminous, unusual and evocative novel
text_review: 'Where the Crawdads Sing' is one of my favourite reads this year.  It is beautifully written, with the North Carolina marsh coast assuming a personality of its own.  Kya, the 'Marsh Girl', abandoned to grow up alone is a unique character, who I empathised with throughout.  It's rare for me to be moved to tears by a novel, but this happened twice in the closing pages.  Her luminous spirit, and her story, will remain with me for a long time.

title: Loved this book!

title: Simply beautiful
text_review: Simply beautiful.You will love this if you appreciate beautiful prose and crafted narrative. It‚Äôs not the story - it‚Äôs the writing, and I knew this was awe-inspiring from the first sentence.About 35000 people have rated this book 5 stars - those who haven‚Äôt might rightly consider what they might be missing.

title: Loved it ‚ù§Ô∏è

title: Review of where the craw dads Sind

title: Great story

title: Good as reviews
text_review: I enjoyed this book a deviation from my usual reads.Slightly over descriptive but it does draw you into the characters and environmentsSomewhat predictable but I read in 2 days.

title: Stunning, evocative, brilliant
text_review: If there were 6 stars this novel would deserve it. The brilliant descriptions of the wildlife of the marshes makes them as real as the beautifully portrayed central human characters. But this story also holds a mirror up to all of us, and if we dare, lets us reflect on our own prejudice. All this is wrapped up in a heart stopping suspense thriller of the best kind.

title: Kept me reading for the first time in 2 years
text_review: Best book I can remember. Just could not put it down and very sad to finish it. Not the normal book I would go for, but definitely the best. Would highflying recommend.

title: 4* read
text_review: A book out of my usual condo zone but what a great, moving book that kept you reading.This covered such an emotional rollercoaster  for the various characters from nurturing to loathing.Would recommend this for others to make you realise just how easy some of us have our lives and how grateful we should be.

title: I fell in love with this book
text_review: Whilst the story gets off to a slow start, I gradually fell in love with Kya and the beautiful landscapes of coastal North Carolina. The story draws you into the rhythms of nature and the power of the connection between humans and the natural world. This is juxtaposed with the cruelty and horror of man‚Äôs prejudice and discrimination against perceived difference. A moving portrayal of the journey from rejection to acceptance.

title: A brilliant and compelling book
text_review: A wonderful, moving and compelling book that works on many levels... a love story, a mystery and a poetic, timely and inspirational appreciation of the value of connecting with nature.

title: A diffferent story
text_review: So different from my usual crime reading material preference.  This was a superbly written story, written by someone who knows her subject well, and with an unexpected conclusion.

title: Great book!
text_review: I enjoyed this book. Thought it was easy to read and it kept my interest throughout. Not sure about the negative reviews. Enjoyed the descriptions answer general story.

title: A refreshing different read for all!
text_review: This beautifully written, full of fascinating detail and accuracy, made me cry twice in sympathy with characters. It comes to a boil about three quarters of the way through and I couldn't put it down. The Marsh Girl as she was called defies all prejudice against her and shows herself to be pure and clear in her lifestyle with an inate love of the wildlife in her marsh. I loved this book.

title: Fabulous
text_review: Details about the marsh and the survival of a young girl in very hard conditions. Exceptionally emotional to see how the girl goes through pain and loss as she grows into a young woman

title: Just brilliant

The book fascinates with its background of the natural world set against a crime scene . Beautifully crafted and superbly written , fabulous twists lead to a very satisfactory ending . Wonderful

title: excellent book

title: Brilliant read

title: Murder in the Marshes
text_review: This is a wonderful book about some very delicate topics: alcoholism, ostracism, marital abuse, mental illness, child abandonment and revenge to name a few. But it‚Äôs also about love and kindness and how survival is possible with the smallest seeds of hope. The plot oscillates between past and present and a murder investigation that will have you riveted. Delia Owens sets the story in the environmentally rich North Carolina marshes. A highly recommended read.

title: Feel yourself transported!
text_review: I always know within the first chapter whether a book has drawn me in initially I thought the story was good but then all of a sudden I found myself there in the marshes almost like I wasn't reading a book I was experiencing it like an onlooker. I was hooked. I won't ruin the plot but if you pick this title up you will not be disappointed.

title: A deeply thoughtful whodunnit

title: A stunning story of strength and survival

title: Beautiful, insightful, heart warming

title: Sadness and Joy!
text_review: I loved this book which conveys a sadness out of loneliness but joy out of simple pleasures and interests.  It offers no excuse for the cruelty of prejudice in all it's forms and portrays the kindness of a few accepted and rejected in preference for a solitary life  The marsh is brought to life in this beautifully written novel with twists and turns in the life of a gifted 'orphan'.

title: Brilliant.

title: The best thing I have read in a long time
text_review: A beautifully written book, narrating a poignant tale in such a way,  it transports you to the marshes it describes and makes you feel that you have actually been there. The characters are rich and real and the story unfolds right up to the very last page , after which I felt a sense of loss having nothing left to read- I didn‚Äôt want the story to end!

title: Brilliant
text_review: Could not put it down. Lovely language and an understanding of nature and ecology. Worth whatever you have to pay. Myself an author, I'm jealous of Delia's skills.

title: Stick with it!
text_review: Slow to start because you have to adapt to the dialect, but once it‚Äôs clicked in you‚Äôll enter Kya‚Äôs world of a strange charm and challenges. I absolutely loved this book. It‚Äôs unique and compelling.

title: JA''S kindle
text_review: This is the most beautiful book I have ever read. Simply wonderful. Resorcefulness,tenacity,longing are all included in the nature of this writer. Please write another novel. To suffer the prejudice as a six year old child-onwards. I urge everyone to read it. Thank you. JA

title: Where the Crawdad's Sing

title: Well written

The description of the swamp land and it‚Äôs wildlife was a completely new world for me as I knew nothing about this part of the United States,I could have done without the murder/mystery plot as I think the book could have stood on its own without it.

title: A beautiful, almost poetical novel, of love, nature and survival
text_review: I read this over two nights - often with blurry eyes. I was sobbing with emotion by the end.A powerful love story. Far-fetched and almost mystical at times, but these early irritations were engulfed by the gentle but persistent details of nature‚Äôs beauty and the reality of human resilience. A moving novel that will stay with me for some time. Read this book.

title: Poetic and immersive.

title: Beautiful

Her sad lonely existence enriched by her love of nature. The book so eloquently teaches about prejudice and bias against those who are different. It‚Äôs set in a time when women and coloureds were seen as inferior. I feel quite bereft that I‚Äôve finished the book. I would recommend

title: Crawdads - great!

title: A truly wonderful first novel by Delia Owens.
text_review: A very thought provoking and absorbing read.  Would definitely recommend this book to others.  Extremely well written.  In this book the author transports you to 1960s America, and the marsh becomes somewhere we can all escape too.  Kya's sense of loneliness is something we can all relate to at this time.

title: Totally absorbing
text_review: Unique yet believable characters woven into a story that I shall never forget.  I felt the fresh air of the marshes and the strong love that was there as well as the pains of rejection and loss.  References to the wildlife were fascinating.

title: Gripping ...right to the last page
text_review: This book was nothing I would usually read however I gave it a go due to such high reviews. I can honestly say this book was the best and most gripping I have ever read. I would highly recommend and will sure be reading more from this author.

title: Didn‚Äôt want it to end
text_review: Great book. I think this will remain forever as a favourite book of mine along with To Kill aMockingbird and The Kite RunnerIf you enjoyed either of those titles then you will love this. I was almost afraid of finishing it, when you find yourself so attached to the main character you just don‚Äôt want it to end. Loved it.

title: Beautifully written story
text_review: Loved this book very, very much.  Hauntingly beautiful and evocative.  Wondrous writing and poetically done in parts.  Gripping story.  Just wonderful.

title: Beautifully told!
text_review: Absolutely loved this book, takes you through Kyas life at a comfortable pase. So descriptive, it's like watching a film. Made me cry and smile, a great book from start to end. Loved it!

title: Twists and turns
text_review: The next book in our family book club, full of twists and turns, the story of a young abandoned girl to murder and mystery with a twist at the end.

title: This is an absolute must read

To understand fully, it needs to be read

title: Survival and achievement
text_review: A very different story!.  Wonderful descriptions of a remote marshy environment in Carolina.  Kya, a child of ten years, survives against all odds.  Her observations of the wild environment in which she lives make such an impression on her that she begins to collect and record what she sees.  From extreme deprivation, she emerges as a woman of incredible talent.

title: What a belter
text_review: I couldn‚Äôt put this down, the story gripped me from start to finish. Before I started it I wondered how good it would be when the main character lives in isolation. The author had my emotions all over the place, would definitely recommend.

title: Wonderful read
text_review: Superb description of the swamp setting,  and a wonderful story of love and life made this a truly great read  I could not put it down

title: Worth the hype
text_review: Finally read this novel after seeing and hearing about it everywhere. Set in North Carolina, the novel follows the life of Kya. A social outcast and neglected child, we see her grow up and into a thoughtful character.  Owens illustrates the North Carolinian marshes and the nature that lives there. With a murder thrown in too, this book is a pageturner for sure.

title: Moving and beautiful
text_review: Beautifully written that makes your imagination and thoughts stretch. A wonderful moving story. Couldn't put it down. The writing is so descriptive, you can feel it .

title: Captivating Novel

title: Wonderful book
text_review: A must read, I didn‚Äôt want to put the book down but I had to because I didn‚Äôt want it to end.. such a dilemma.. you will not be disappointed reading this

The writing has depth, creativity and clarity. It transports you to the marshes and you can see them in all their glory and wonder. I was left guessing to the very end. A beautiful beautiful book

title: Tedious and Immature ...

title: THIS WILL MAKE YOU SMILE AND CRY & CRY SOME MORE...
text_review: This book takes you straight to the marshes of North Carolina to a place where, most of us can only ever reach through a book as well-written as this! title: One of the best books I have ever read and I am ancient !

title: A brilliant and moving read

title: Deeply moving!

title: Love this book

It is exceptionally well written and Owen‚Äôs detailed knowledge of nature(she‚Äôs marine biologist!)is evident in every sentence. Unique story. A must read.

text_review: I‚Äôd read my rave reviews about this book but found it very disappointing.  It seems as if the author wanted to ‚Äòjazz‚Äô up a story with a ‚Äòwhodunnit‚Äô ending.  If she had left it as the description of the protagonist‚Äôs life in a remote part of the world it would have been so much better.

title: Excellent read.

title: A story, wrapped-up in a meditation, smothered in nature.

All the while absorbing, enigmatic, evocative.  A thoroughly enjoyable read.  A film version will surely come.

title: Delia Owens

title: Incredibly brilliant!
text_review: This is a magnificent novel that has had a lasting effect on me. Delia Owens is a simply sublime storyteller, carefully crafting her characters and vividly depicting every scene. It gets better and better as the novel progresses, leaving me unable to put it down. I am truly worried that no other novel will now come close. Thank you, Delia Owens - you had me spellbound, regaling everyone with your brilliance!

title: Where the Crawdads Sing is an exquisite anthem of survival, love, and the unexpected
text_review: Exquisite. So beautifully and artfully written. Delia Owens has penned a heart-wrenchingly original story that took this reader into an unknown world. It captures and affirms what happens, at a cellular level, when a very young person experiences trauma, abandonment, profound loneliness and unrelenting grief from loss. At once it also offers a window onto the soul of a survivor. This book is one of the very best I have ever read.

title: fantastic book
text_review: I really enjoyed this beautiful and moving

title: I was drawn into this story from the first page - beautifully written - a wonderful escape

It is not inconceivable that such significant neglect could be so overlooked with a 7 year old child living alone without supports but perceived resilience would be beyond the capacity of any young child.

title: Not convincing but well written
text_review: A good story, well written and well read (Audible version), but flawed.You need to suspend credibility that an 8 year old girl could survive independently and gain a degree level education after just a few tutorials in reading.But the ultimate flaw is in the conclusion. Would someone who has never caught a bus before be capable of navigating complex timetables to return overnight whilst carrying two full disguises in a cardboard suitcase? No. So the conclusion spoiled it for me. There were other flaws in the conclusion too, but I don‚Äôt want to detail them too much as it gives away too much of the plot.I wonder if this is more popular in the US where readers may be more interested in recent social history?I was far from convinced.

title: Simply mesmerising
text_review: üêöI jumped at the chance to be read this, because I felt like I must have been one of the last people on the planet to read this book - so I was dying to finally know what all the hype was about!üêöBeing first and foremost a murder mystery, I was drawn in to this book quickly and soon became obsessed with being back in the marsh with Kya.  I could hear the whistle of the wind in the trees and the splash and gurgle of the water in the marsh.  With deliciously lucid and vivid prose; It was such a joyful escape of a read.üêöOwens is a real wizard with words.  I adored her sumptuous descriptions of the marsh and her turn of phrase really gave the marsh its own character in the novel.  Her writing is effortlessly elegant and so wonderfully easy to read and lose yourself in.üêöWhilst this has been dubbed a ‚ÄúComing of Age‚Äù novel, (a statement which I don‚Äôt at all disagree with), Where The Crawdads Sing, in my opinion, is so much more.  It depicts how a human survives abandonment and complete isolation; learning to fend for herself and become totally self sufficient.  In time we learn how these sad circumstances impact on her emotional and social interactions with other humans later on in life.üêöA breathtaking, soulful and simply mesmerising book; I have no doubt that Where The Crawdads Sing will be one of my top reads of 2020.

title: An average story. Feel free to pass it by.
text_review: It takes Reese Witherspoon to flash a book cover and the whole world goes nuts for the novel! I understand why Reese would feel for the book - it describes in minute detail life of the the marsh of North Carolina and Atlantic coast - something that is close to her heart. But this does not make "Where the Crawdads Sing" a great novel. It is not. It is not a great love story, not a thrilling murder mystery and it is not a great detective story. It is just an okay read.After all the rave reviews I was expecting something exceptional but was completely underwhelmed. The characters were underdeveloped and lacked any depth, the plot was rushed and the little twist in the end did not blow my socks off. I did not really care for the twist.There were a couple of chapters that made me hold my breath and wonder how the story would develop, for this I give it three stars. But overall - feel free to pass this by.

title: Sorry, just not for me...
text_review: Gorgeous nature writing but a story which I found frankly sentimental, full of cliches, melodramatic and just oh so predictable. I found it difficult to buy into this romanticized vision of the 'wild child of nature', and long descriptions of marshland flora and fauna, while poetic, felt stranded aimlessly without a story to fill the foreground. Just not for me, sorry.

title: Haunting novel set on the marshlands of North Carolina
